07103.description: Be a part of the Lights On program at West Side High School in Newark. This program keeps students engaged in activities so they are safe and off the streets. Volunteers ages 18 and older are needed each Friday night for activities ranging from art, sports, music, video and board games, beauty and fashion. Have another interest you would like to share? That would be great too! The program is from 6-10 pm and volunteers are needed for 6-8pm shift, 8-10 pm shift, or both.
07103.title: Lights On in Newark

08550.description: Dear Residents of West Windsor- Plainsboro Regional School District Do you want to make a difference in a young person's life; while you learn about another culture, create and build friendships and make ever-lasting memories? Do you have a caring heart and extra space in your home? AnB Education is looking for you! Make a difference today and host an international student! All our students need is: A Private bedroom with a desk, bed and dresser 2 meals a day on school days and 3 meals a day on non school days Transportation to and from school if there is no school buses provided Please contact AnB Headquarters office at: 267.263.2481 or email to contact@anbeducation.com Company website: www.anbeducation.com
08550.title: Volunteer Host Families for International students

07104.description: Spread The Purpleis a 501 (c) (3) nonprofit organization who is devoted to making a difference in the community. It is our mission to provide guidance to both individuals and families for the right resources and assistance they can use during unexpected circumstance. One of the ways we assist is through our fundraisers, such our Back To School and Services. Overview: Volunteers will be handing out: Backpacks, School Supplies, Food, and more. FREE Haircuts, FREE Dental and Health Screenings available to all children under 18 years of age. The event is scheduled for 11am to 3pm. on August 4th located in Newark, NJ. We need volunteers to assist with the following: (9:30am to 11:00am) Help with set-up Place various donated school supplies into backpacks Assist with greeting vendor set-up Food set-up During the event we need volunteers to assist with the following: (11:00am to 3:00am) Door Greeter Checking families in at the event Give out backpack containing school supplies Crowd control Handing out food to the kids After the event we need volunteers to assist with break down: (3:00am to 4:00am) All volunteers will be given volunteer t-shirts, as long as, a t-shirt size for each volunteer is provided upon sign via email.
07104.title: Back To School

10453.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. The Editor is responsible for reviewing articles submitted by The Borgen Project’s national team of writers. Editors will also perform edits for articles appearing on BORGEN Magazine and The Borgen Project Blog. Our volunteer position is a part-time, work from home role. You can set your own schedule and specify how many hours per week you wish to work. - Edit and format articles submitted by national writers. - Work with writers to improve their articles. Qualifications: Must have great editing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing SEO friendly content is helpful, but not required. To apply: Please email a copy of your resume and two writing samples to hr@borgenproject.org
10453.title: Volunteer Editor- New York

10453.description: Position Overview: We are seeking a volunteer videographer/editor in the New York City area with some experience to produce a short video or possibly a series of short videos. We are looking for someone ambitious, creative, quick and professional. The primary responsibility of the role is to film interviews with individuals experiencing homelessness or who have lived through homelessness and are now housed, and editing them into short videos that drive high levels of social media engagement. The ideal candidate has a strong knowledge of video storytelling. Skills and Experience Required Knowledge of cameras, lenses and sound equipment Must have own camera and lighting equipment Proven ability to create shareable digital video (shooting, editing, lighting, audio recording etc.) Proven experience with video editing (Premiere Pro, Final Cut, and similar programs) Proven understanding of the kinds of content that generates engagement on social media platforms. Ability to create content quickly, experiment with lots of different formats, and analyze the results of your work. Highly communicative Ability to provide a quick turn-around on work Passion for storytelling and new media Ideal candidate has strong knowledge of video storytelling Interviewing skills, a plus Graphic design skills, a plus Interested candidates should email their portfolio to Arthena Sherwood at Asherwood@cfhnyc.org.
10453.title: Volunteer Videographer Needed For Video Series To Tell The Stories of Homeless Women

10452.description: We need a highly organized, self-motivated, and outgoing volunteer to help us prepare and deliver Cook Play Live’s Sprout Healthy Cooking and Nutrition program for 25 middle-schoolers on July 11, 18, 25 and Aug 1 from 9:00 am to 11:30 am and July 9 and 23 from 10:30 am to 1:00 pm Where possible, we ask that you commit to multiple sessions as familiarity improves the experience for both volunteers and workshop participants. You will: Engage with and direct middle schoolers in various activities including meal preparation and nutrition discussions Work as a team with educators to prepare for and implement interactive cooking and healthy eating activities following a provided curriculum Set up food preparation and cooking equipment, supplies, and educational materials Maintain food safety, including cleaning and sanitation of all cooking equipment used in cooking activities Our ideal volunteer has: Basic knife skills and ability to execute basic cooking techniques Awareness of healthy eating and basic nutrition knowledge Dynamic personality and excellent interpersonal and communications skills Ability to stand and walk for extended periods, and carrying heavy and bulky items Experience working with young children (aged 10-13 years) in a group setting is a plus!
10452.title: Volunteer with Cook Play Live's Sprout Middle School Program

10452.description: We need a highly organized, self-motivated, and outgoing volunteer to help us prepare and deliver Cook Play Live’s Bud Elementary School kids on July 13, 20, 27 and Aug 3, 10 from 2:15 pm to 4:45 pm Where possible, we ask that you commit to multiple sessions as familiarity improves the experience for both volunteers and workshop participants. You will: Engage with and direct elementary schoolers in various activities including meal preparation and nutrition discussions Work as a team with educators to prepare for and implement interactive cooking and healthy eating activities following a provided curriculum Set up food preparation and cooking equipment, supplies, and educational materials Maintain food safety, including cleaning and sanitation of all cooking equipment used in cooking activities Our ideal volunteer has: Basic knife skills and ability to execute basic cooking techniques Awareness of healthy eating and basic nutrition knowledge Dynamic personality and excellent interpersonal and communications skills Ability to stand and walk for extended periods, and carrying heavy and bulky items Experience working with young children (aged 7-10 years) in a group setting is a plus!
10452.title: Volunteer with Cook Play Live's Bud Elementary School Program 2

10452.description: We need a highly organized, self-motivated, and outgoing volunteer to help us prepare and deliver Cook Play Live’s Bud Elementary School kids on July 13, 20, 27 and Aug 3, 10 from 12:15 pm to 2:45 pm Where possible, we ask that you commit to multiple sessions as familiarity improves the experience for both volunteers and workshop participants. You will: Engage with and direct elementary schoolers in various activities including meal preparation and nutrition discussions Work as a team with educators to prepare for and implement interactive cooking and healthy eating activities following a provided curriculum Set up food preparation and cooking equipment, supplies, and educational materials Maintain food safety, including cleaning and sanitation of all cooking equipment used in cooking activities Our ideal volunteer has: Basic knife skills and ability to execute basic cooking techniques Awareness of healthy eating and basic nutrition knowledge Dynamic personality and excellent interpersonal and communications skills Ability to stand and walk for extended periods, and carrying heavy and bulky items Experience working with young children (aged 7-10 years) in a group setting is a plus!
10452.title: Be Part of Cook Play Live's Bud Elementary School Program 1

10451.description: Live Healthy! is looking for a few volunteers to be a part of their Greenmarket Nutrition Workshop and Culinary Demos team. Three times a week with 2 shift options including morning shift (9 am-12 pm) or afternoon shift (12 pm-3 pm). Live Healthy! provides nutrition workshops on how to increase fruits and vegetable intake while providing a delicious and nutritious recipe demo that includes ingredients found right at the farmers' market. Volunteers are needed to help with set-up, break-down, and overall management of the workshops. Someone with a can do attitude, who's ready to take the initiative, and who thoroughly enjoys interacting with people as a representative of NYCP in the community would be an ideal candidate. It's a team effort out at the Greenmarket, and each person plays a vital role! Volunteers must be at least 16 years or older, be able to lift at least 30 lbs, and be comfortable in a variety of outdoor environments.
10451.title: Join NYCP's Nutrition Education Team at the Farmers' Market!

10451.description: Overview: South Bronx United College Advisory Inters work closely with SBU's Director of College Guidance and Alumni to help coordinate and supervise the College Prep Program. Interns work 2 days per week and get hands on experience administering an educational program, tracking student progress towards college, and advising students on academic needs. The internship is perfect for those looking to gain experience in the fields of educational administration and college counseling. Summer inters will be working with the SBU rising seniors to prepare for the college application process during SBU's Summer Scholars Program. When: Wednesdays and Fridays July 11th - August 10th Where: Health Opportunities High Schoool 350 Gerard Ave The Bronx, NY 10451 Qualifications: Enthusiastic and caring with a specific interest in education and youth empowerment. Should have a background in working with youth. Experience and knowledge of the college application process, financial aid, and the SUNY & CUNY college application processes Bachelor's Degree Commitment: Interns should commit to a full day on Fridays and a partial day on Wednesdays for the duration of the Summer Scholars program. Training: All inters will receive training from the Director of College Guidance and Alumni. Benefits: While the position is unpaid, inters have the opportunity to work directly with our Director fo College Guidance and our Director of Education Programs to learn firsthand the best practices for ensuring a pathway to college for all students. Responsibilities in Detail: Track program attendance and progress of all students Family outreach/student outreach to improve student attendance at programs Manage procurement and entry of student records and documents (transcripts, report cards, tax returns, waivers, etc.) Research important college prep resources needed for each student (relevant scholarships, trade schools, additional SAT Prep & Regents Prep resources, GED option, etc.)
10451.title: College Advisory Internship - Summer

10451.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Friday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Man Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
10451.title: Volunteer for the Jimmy Fund at Concourse Plaza Multiplex in Bronx, NY!

10451.description: OVERVIEW: South Bronx United is seeking energetic individuals with a passion for youth development and sports to join the Up2Us Coaching program. Each South Bronx United Up2Us member will serve as the Team Mentor and head or assistant soccer coach for a team of youth within the SBU Academy Program. In addition to mentoring and coaching a competitive soccer team, the Up2Us member will have an additional focus area, either helping with coordination and coaching of SBU’s Community Soccer Programs OR assisting with coordination and program delivery of the SBU After School Tutoring/College Prep Programs. Up2Us members will have the opportunity to see the inner working of a small, growing non profit and gain professional experience and skills in the fields of education, teaching, counseling, and coaching. As a part time position this requires approximately 15-20 hours/week. The full time position requires 35-40 hours a week. A living stipend will be offered in accordance with the Up2Us part-time position policies. Additionally, those who complete the year will be considered for further paid SBU coaching positions. In addition to site-specific duties at South Bronx United, members are also responsible for the following Up2Us program requirements: Completing timesheets; Attending the Up2Us National Coaching Institute, Attending professional development and training seminars every other month; Reflecting on their work in guided reflection logs; and Participating in a National Day of Service The Up2Us program is an intense experience and members are asked to go above and beyond each and every day at their hosts site (South Bronx United). Being a part of the Up2Us program connects members both with their local communities and a larger national movement of people dedicated to serving youth through sports. Up2Us positions are offered in conjunction with the Americorps or Office of Juvenile Justice mentorship programs. RESPONSIBILITIES: As a Team Mentor & Coach, the Up2Us member will: * Serve as first point of staff level contact for a group of approx 20 youth (mentees) * Help plan, set, and keep students on their program schedule * Maintain weekly contact with each mentee in person and via phone, * Maintain regular contact with mentees’ parent/guardian * Monitor student academic performance, and assist in the collection of student report cards, transcripts, and school documents, * Work with SBU Youth Counselor and Education Director to identify social, emotional, and academic issues or concerns * Check email daily and maintain good communication with SBU office staff * Enforce attendance and program policies * Serve as a head or assistant coach for 1 SBU travel soccer team, planning and leading training sessions, coaching at games, and travelling with students to games and events. * Track attendance data from soccer and academic sessions. * Complete progress reports for each mentee two times per year. Additionally Up2Us Coaches will either: * Assist with coordination and program delivery of the After School Tutoring Program and/or College Prep program, helping managing the learning environment, tracking student attendance and providing direct academic support OR * Assist with the coordination of the SBU recreational program, supporting volunteer soccer coaches, leading recreational practices, and helping with coach trainings. LOCATION* SBU Office: South Bronx United, 594 Grand Concourse, Suite 2, Bronx, NY 10451 Academic Site: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY Primary Soccer Site: Macomb’s Dam Park, 161st Street, Bronx, NY 10451 *Most service will be performed at soccer or academic sites SCHEDULE: The term of service runs August 1, 2017-July 31, 2018. The following hours are approximate, times may change slightly. Team Coach & Mentor w/Soccer Focus * T/Th, 6-8pm (Academy Soccer Practice) * T/W/Th, 3:30-6pm (Recreational Practice) OR Sat, 8-3pm (Recreational Games) * Sun (dependent on game schedules) Team Coach & Mentor w/Academic Focus * M/W, 5:30-8pm OR T/Th, 3:30-6pm (Tutoring/College Prep) * T/Th, 6-8pm (Academy Soccer Practice) * Sat or Sun (dependent on game schedules) **Those serving in a full time capacity will coach and mentor 2 teams and will assist with soccer programming on both Saturdays and Sunday** COMPENSATION: Coaches will receive a $9,000 living stipend for their service over the course of 12 months as well as a $500 bonus upon successful completion of their one year term of service. All HR related matters are handled by Up2Us. Learn more about the Up2Us program at https://www.up2us.org/coach-across-america. **Those working full time will receive approx 15,000 and a 5,700 educational award** QUALIFICATIONS: Enthusiastic to work with youth, committed to holistic youth development with a strong knowledge of soccer. Previous coaching experience is not a necessity. Coach/Mentors with an Academic Focus should have a strong academic background and feel comfortable with SAT level math and English. Coach must also be a us citizen or permanent resident. HOW TO APPLY: To apply email info@southbronxunited.org with a cover letter and resume.
10451.title: AmeriCorps UP2US Coach & Mentor

08873.description: MuckFest MS is the FUN mud-run with the best obstacles, and 100% of our fundraising dollars benefit the National Multiple Sclerosis Society. With 18+ eye-popping obstacles along a 5k course, it takes hundreds of volunteers to make the mucky magic happen. We'll be in New Jersey on Saturday, July 21st, and we want you to come get dirty with us. All MuckFest MS volunteers receive: Free parking at the event A nifty MuckFest MS Volunteer t-shirt Snacks, drinks, and lunch A special thank you gift just for volunteers! Our endless gratitude and that warm, fuzzy feeling that comes from helping out a great cause. You and your colleagues, family members, and friends can register to volunteer by going to the link below. http://main.nationalmssociety.org/site/PageServer?pagename=HOM_MUCK_MuckFest_volunteer We need AFTERNOON (approx. 12:00-5:00 PM) VOLUNTEERS the most! If you register for Shift 2, type the code JERSEYNEEDSME in the Special Requests box, and you'll get a BONUS thank you gift. Questions? We’ve got answers! Please email info@muckfestms.com. MuckFest MS: Built For Laughs!
08873.title: Pssst....hey...are you down to Muck?

08873.description: Incredible people. Great cause. Muck-tacular fun. And it's also one of the coolest volunteer gigs around. MuckFest MS is the fun mud and obstacle 5K for everyone. If you can laugh, you can do it. Volunteers are needed to assist with a variety of shifts including: Check-In/Traffic Flow Course Festival area We offer a variety of shifts to fit your schedule! Volunteers get: Volunteer T-shirt A free lunch Free parking. To register or learn more visit www.muckfestms.com
08873.title: Get Dirty & Volunteer @ MuckFest MS!
08873.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

08873.description: New people to join a dedicated core group who provide Basic Life Support ambulance service.
08873.title: Emergency Medical Technician

08873.description: The 5K Walk 4 Life Breast Cancer Awareness Run/Walk highlights the commitment Sisters Network of Central NJ has to advancing breast cancer education, awareness, advocacy and community outreach. It is a celebration of survivorship and also serves as a remembrance of loved ones who succumbed to this disease.
08873.title: SNCNJ 5K Run / Walk 4 Life
08873.org: Sisters Network of Central New Jersey

10455.description: Masa invites you to join our summer program! By tutoring once a week you can be a part of the change. Join us in transforming communities through education - one family, one child at a time! We are seeking dedicated volunteers to be a part of our literacy initiative, 1.5 hours a week. Volunteers will work with students going into grades 4-6 to help improve their literacy skills, so they go into the next school year as confident learners and readers. About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and family to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy Intensive program: During the summer, Masa will help students struggling in literacy to boost their phonemic awareness, vocabulary and reading comprehension. In the area where Masa operates, just 25% of third-graders read at grade level - so additional support is critical! Volunteer Duties: Literacy volunteers will: Work with small groups of students going into grades 4-6 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: Work with students to identify, hear and manipulate sounds in words using games Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteer Requirements: Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 2 pm to 3:30 pm beginning July 9th, 2018, through August 18th, 2018 Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed Fill out volunteer application and interview with Masa staff
10455.title: Help students in grades 4-6 boost their literacy skills during the summer!

10455.title: Help students in grades 4-6 boost their literacy skills during the summer!

10455.description: Masa is seeking dedicated volunteers who are interested in working as part of a team to help support our six-week Summer STEM program in which Masa scholars hone their creativity and engineering skills by designing innovative robots with a focus on the local community. The Summer STEM Program will end with an interactive showcase open to students and their families. Where: Masa South Bronx Community Center, easily accessible by the 2 and 5 trains to the 149th Street-3rd Avenue train station (just 2 stops into the Bronx) When: The Summer STEM Program will begin on July 9th, 2018 and will end on August 16th, 2018 Time: The Summer Robotics Program will operate on Mondays and Tuesdays from 10:30 am - 1:30 pm, and Wednesdays and Thursdays from 10:30 am - 1:00 pm (volunteers are asked to commit to at least one consistent day per week) What: We are looking for dedicated volunteers to support our Robotics instructor. Volunteers will help facilitate daily lesson plans and activities, as well as help manage participating scholars. Prior background in STEM or Robotics is NOT required but a strong interest and knowledge of STEM subjects is highly welcomed. TRAINING will be provided. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer at least once a week on a consistent basis Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date Willingness to work with scholars going into grades 4 to 6 (ages 9 to 12) Willing and able to help facilitate lesson plans to students, in small group settings, and under the leadership of our Robotics instructor Help manage behavior and lead scholars through daily instruction Attend summer interactive showcase (if schedule permits) Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff Fill out volunteer application and interview with Masa staff
10455.title: Volunteer at a summer STEM program!

Where: Masa South Bronx Community Center, easily accessible by the 2 and 5 trains to the 149th Street-3rd Avenue train station (just 2 stops into the Bronx) When: The Summer STEM Program will begin on July 9th, 2018 and will end on August 16th, 2018 Time: The Summer Robotics Program will operate on Mondays and Tuesdays from 10:30 am - 1:30 pm, and Wednesdays and Thursdays from 10:30 am - 1:00 pm (volunteers are asked to commit to at least one consistent day per week) What: We are looking for dedicated volunteers to support our Robotics instructor. Volunteers will help facilitate daily lesson plans and activities, as well as help manage participating scholars. Prior background in STEM or Robotics is NOT required but a strong interest and knowledge of STEM subjects is highly welcomed. TRAINING will be provided. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer at least once a week on a consistent basis Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date Willingness to work with scholars going into grades 4 to 6 (ages 9 to 12) Willing and able to help facilitate lesson plans to students, in small group settings, and under the leadership of our Robotics instructor Help manage behavior and lead scholars through daily instruction Attend summer interactive showcase (if schedule permits) Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff Fill out volunteer application and interview with Masa staff
10455.title: Volunteer at a summer STEM program!

10455.description: Masa invites you to join our summer program! By tutoring once a week you can be a part of the change. Join us in transforming communities through education - one family, one child at a time! We are seeking dedicated volunteers to be a part of our literacy initiative, 1.5 hours a week. Volunteers will work with students going into grades 4-6 to help improve their literacy skills, so they go into the next school year as confident learners and readers. About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and family to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy Intensive program: During the summer, Masa will help students struggling in literacy to boost their phonemic awareness, vocabulary and reading comprehension. In the area where Masa operates, just 25% of third-graders read at grade level - so additional support is critical! Volunteer Duties: Literacy volunteers will: Work with small groups of students going into grades 4-6 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: Work with students to identify, hear and manipulate sounds in words using games Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteer Requirements: Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 2 pm to 3:30 pm beginning July 9th, 2018, through August 18th, 2018 Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed Fill out volunteer application and interview with Masa staff
10455.title: Help students in grades 4-6 boost their literacy skills during the summer!

10455.description: Girl Vow, Inc is seeking volunteer women mentors who can conduct various gender-focused workshops or who are interested in mentoring a girl for an academic year. You must live in the NYC area. Please send an updated resume to the email address girlvow@gmail.com.
10455.title: Mentor Girls in the Foster Care & Juvenile Justice Systems

10012.description: Rescue catered leftovers from 2 offices in SoHo! This event will end at Bowery Mission, located at 227 Bowery, New York, NY 10002. Medium weight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is 30-50 pounds.
10012.title: Fight Hunger is Soho Fridays 3:30PM!

10012.description: NYU has some delicious catering every other week. We need volunteers to pick up this catering and deliver it to a nearby shelter. Heavy pickup: 15-90 pounds
10012.title: Assist NYU in the Fight Against Food Waste Fridays 3:30PM!

07066.description: We need your help and support! This year, the Autism Speaks Union and Morris County Walk will distribute thousands of print materials to over 750 locations throughout the Union and Morris County area. Volunteers, like you, are needed to accomplish this massive feat. On Saturday, August 4, we'll be papering key locations across Union County, New Jersey. There are just three easy steps to postering the town for Autism Speaks: Visit assigned locations Ask permission to display an Autism Speaks Walk poster in a heavily trafficked area in their facility (stores, restaurants, doctors offices, places of worship, schools, etc.) Record locations address The Autism Speaks Walk is Autism Speaks' signature fundraising event, bringing together thousands of families impacted by autism to raise critically needed funds that fuel our mission to improve lives today and accelerate a spectrum of solutions for tomorrow. With your help, more families than ever before will learn about this wonderful day that celebrates all of those living with autism. So grab a group of friends, pick up some posters, and get going!
07066.title: Poster the Town (Union County) for the Autism Speaks Union and Morris County Walk

07066.description: Homeside Hospice is looking for volunteers to provide companionship to patients in their home or nursing home in the Princeton and Mercerville Areas. As a companion you will provide a listening ear and a sharing spirit to enhance the patient's emotional and spiritual well-being. As a volunteer you will provide essential, quality of life services to patients. Your efforts will provide the sort of care and help that a loving friend provides and help insure that the Hospice promise is fulfilled. Some visits might include reading, watching TV, taking walks, playing music, talking about their life and their family, or shared silence.
07066.title: Volunteer companions needed for hospice patients in Union County

10459.description: The HopeLine is a social service agency in the South Bronx that provides basic resources such as food and diapers, as well as Benefit enrollment services and classes-ESL & Civics, and Computer training. We are looking for a volunteer Computer Instructor who can teach a 6 week workshop and potentially other similar workshops after. The workshop will provide lessons to learn the \"Introduction to Microsoft Office\". Providing participants a basic tutorial in 3 Microsoft Office programs. Word Excel Powerpoint This class is an introduction for those looking to learn about programs used in schools and businesses. This will lead to other workshops such as \"Introduction to Excel\", \"Advanced Powerpoint\" etc. Each student who participates will learn how to access each program, what the benefits are for work and/or school related activities, and they will learn simple tasks such as printing, creating a table, copy & paste, key shortcuts, etc. As the instructor you will work closely with the Executive Director on setting up some of those specific goals and work with lesson plans that you help create. This class is set up on Tuesdays 3:30-5:30pm, however, this can be adjusted to better fit your schedule. The class can hold 8 to 10 students at a given time and will last 6 weeks. The class is taught using laptops and a smart board, we ask that the volunteer stay up to 30 minutes after class to put away the equipment. We are looking for someone that is very comfortable with working on a computer and has advanced knowledge on Microsoft Office programs. We prefer someone that has teaching experience however we are also excited to help someone who wants their first opportunity in teaching through this experience. Class language will be based on enrollment, the languages may be English or Spanish and therefore require that you are bilingual. We can also start the class sooner if it works better for your schedule, please contact the Executive Director, Maria Cintron, if you are interested.

Saturdays * 11am to 2pm April 21 through November 17

This is mainly for spanish speakers that have trouble with writing and reading but there is another opportunity for english speakers as well. 07505.description: St. Paul’s Community Development Corporation - SPCDC Next Step Workforce Development Program Service Title: Teacher’s Aide Purpose: The purpose of this position is to assist the Next Step Workforce Development Program their comprehensive educational program encompassing career counseling, job development, job training, workforce development, adult basic education, and case management services. The program’s goal is to enhance their students’ academic skills so they can become self-sufficient and find gainful employment. This AmeriCorps position does not duplicate or displace staff of agency or service site. Service Responsibilities Include: Assist with the coordination of student appointments with outside resources Provide one-on-one tutorials for students in need Observe in classrooms to become familiar with classroom routines, textbooks and materials, and the main topics of major subjects taught Co-teach basic skills classes, and teach in the absence of the teacher using educational best practices Refer students to case managers for services and resources as needed Assist with the coordination and implementation of special events Assist in maintaining student classwork and homework assignments Training and Evaluation: Attend the St. Paul’s Community Development Corporation and SPCDC Next Step Workforce Development Program Meetings Attend meetings, in-service training sessions identified by SPCDC Next Step Workforce Development Program Assist evaluators in gathering information related to program improvement Attend National Days of Service, AmeriCorps week and events sponsored by the New Jersey Commission on National and Community Service. The program also administers the WIOA Youth Program and the Breaking the Cycle Initiative. The WIOA-Youth Program (Workforce Investment and Opportunity Act) provides a high need population of young adults 16 to 24 years of age with High School Diploma preparation classes and onsite testing. The program also offers access to Next Step's vocational training programs in Energy Efficient Building Maintenance and Culinary Arts. The Breaking the Cycle Initiative provides court involved and formerly incarcerated individual’s transitional job training opportunities. Areas of focus include: Energy Efficient Building Maintenance and Culinary Arts. Site Supervisor Name Title Phone Fax, Email Quay Davis Case Manager Office#(973)232-1339 ext.304 Fax #(862)239-1037 qdavis@stpaulscdcnj.org Service Activities/Responsibilities: Complete weekly intake and assessments with clients using ETO software and orientation paperwork Manage a caseload of clients; monitor their progress toward meeting goals established in their service plans and their participation is required Maintain case management check-ins with clients in person and/or by phone to track their attendance record and program progress. Collaboratively with clients, provide assistance in goal setting and self-development; work as a team with other staff to achieve program wide participation, graduation and retention goals among others. Research and coordinate access to outside referral sources Organize and facilitate groups on various topics (Resilience, Critical Thinking, Collaboration, etc.). Maintain current, accurate, complete and timely documentation for programs progress in charts and databases Service Goals: Provide direct service to clients through case management Built healthy relationships with clients and other community organizations Assist clients with goal setting, time management, and organizational skills Collaborate with staff to collect data and documentation for program progress and reports Position Requirements/Qualifications Experience in human services, social work, educational, or related field Strong written and verbal communication Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills Problem solving and critical thinking skills Training and Evaluation Attend meetings, in-service and training sessions identified by SPCDC AmeriCorps Program and the SPCDC Next Step Workforce Development Program. Attend National Days of Service, AmeriCorps week, and events sponsored by the Corporation for National & Community Service. 07505.description: Embrace Relief is a nonprofit, humanitarian organization that believes in compassion, humanity, and diversity. We strive to bring solace to those in need of proper education every single day. Embrace Relief is looking for both a certified math and English teacher who is willing to tutor high school students for the TABE (Test of Adult Basic Education). We will be launching an educational program called Grad+ and students must pass the TABE test to get into the program. Grad+ is a mentorship program that will help students with standardized testing, career paths, and low grades. This tutoring opportunity for the TABE test will take place at the Passaic County One Stop center in Paterson, NJ. It will start Thursday, June 14 th , and will last approximately one month. The tutoring will take place twice a week, on Tuesday’s and Thursday’s, from 4:30pm-6:30pm.
07505.title: Certified Math and English Teachers Needed!

10028.description: Do you have a few hours to spend helping us devlop programs for young mothers and their babies? The mission of Friends of NYC Nurse-Family Partnereship is to improve the lives of babies and their mothers by providing enhanced benefits for the nationally renowned Nurse-Family Partnership. NFP sends registered nurses to make regular visits to first-time, low-income mothers, from the time the mothers are pregnant until their babies are 2. Friends of NYC NFP is developing and leading LEAP (Learn, Eat, and Play) programs which help the mothers meet and socialize with other young moms while learning about nutrition, finance, making toys out of household objects and much more. We need VOLUNTEERS who can help us create interesting play times for the babies. We'd like to: Showing mothers the importance of interactions with their baby Teach about a rich learning environment Show exercises which will allow babies to explore and learn Programs are held around midday during the week at locations in the boroughs of NYC. If interested, please send resume and phone number.
10028.title: Pre-School Teacher
10028.org: FRIENDS OF NEW YORK CITY NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP INC

10028.description: Are you a singer, guitar player, or have other musical talents appropriate for young mothers and their babies? The babies are all under 2 years of age. If you have appropriate musical experience and talent and would like to entertain in such a situation and you are available week days, we would like to hear from you. Events typically last 2-3 hours; frequency would be once a quarter or more. Please send a note describing your musical background;experience with very young children a big plus. SEND YOUR RESUME AND PHONE NUMBER.
10028.title: Guitarist or Keyboard Player for Mother/Baby Events

Please visit our web site: www.aslanyouth.org to learn more about what we do. Or contact our volunteer coordinator, Janis Marler, for further details. Don't delay! Tutoring is set to begin July 10th!

Service Description : Paterson Public School #15 (Kindergarten - 5th Grade) is a Full Service Community School within the Paterson Public Schools' Full Service Community Schools Initiative. Full-Service Community Schools provide comprehensive academic, social, and health services for students, students’ family members, and community members that will result in improved educational outcomes for children. These services may include: high-quality early learning programs and service; remedial education, aligned with academic supports and other enrichment activities, providing students with a comprehensive academic program; family engagement, including parental involvement, parent leadership, family literacy, and parent education programs; mentoring and other youth development programs; community service and service learning opportunities; programs that provide assistance to students who have been chronically absent, truant, suspended, or expelled; job training and career counseling services; nutrition services and physical activities; primary health and dental care; activities that improve access to and use of social service programs and programs that promote family financial stability; mental health services; and adult education, including instruction of adults in English as a second language. St. Paul’s Community Development Corporation (SPCDC) supports the initiative by providing comprehensive, developmentally appropriate, extended day/year academic enrichment, mentoring and community service opportunities to over 1,300 students at Full Service Community School 15 (FSCS15) and New Roberto Clemente Full Service Community Middle School (NRC). SPCDC also coordinates educational opportunities for school parents and makes other social services available inside the school building.

07501.description: Service Title: Case Manager Aide (AmeriCorps) Program Site: Emergency Men’s Shelter/Partnerships for Healthy Living Reports to: Emergency Men’s Shelter Case/Manager Purpose: The AmeriCorps Case Manager Aide provides case management support to agency clients across all program areas (Food Pantry, Shelter, Next Step and Partnerships for Healthy Living). The Case Manager Aide works collaboratively with St. Paul’s CDC case managers and community-based organizations to provide comprehensive services to guide clients towards self-sufficiency. Service Responsibilities include: Provide comprehensive case management services including: intake assessment, service plan development, coordination of services and referrals, advocacy, crisis intervention, and program maintenance. Collaborate with other agency case managers for necessary case conferencing and in-house referrals. Complete and maintain detailed case files and statistical records including Bi- weekly progress notes, incident reports, program terminations, etc. Enter subsequent data into relevant data systems (i.e. ETO-Efforts To Outcomes, Social Solutions, Inc. and HMIS-Homeless Management Information System, United States Department of Housing and Urban Development) Establish and maintain linkages with other community based organizations and government agencies. Prepare progress reports weekly, monthly, quarterly, bi-annually and annually Perform other related duties as assigned. Compensation: Stipend Qualifications and Requirements College degree in social work, criminal justice or related social science field Significant clerical and file management experience and data processing Strong organizational skills and excellent verbal, writing and communication skills Understanding of socially relevant issues impacting low-income urban communities Computer literacy, including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, internet, and email communications Valid Driver’s License is preferred, but not required ST. 07746.description: Ideal candidate will enjoy conducting research or be pursuing or have received a degree in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, or another field managing numbers or interested in a field where Market Research is essential. Create goals and objectives. Create and conduct surveys of all students and/or parents participating BGCM programs. Verify BGCM is meeting student’s/parent’s expectations of the programs. Examine how BGCM measures up to outcomes and evaluate how BGCM will meet short (knowledge/attitude) and long term outcomes (behavior change). Evaluate programs and qualitative and quantitative data. Create surveys and experience and education to discern exactly which questions to ask. Many funders want to know that our programs are evidence based/needed in the community and works for target population.
07746.title: Evaluator/Researcher

Activities must be at least an hour in length per age group of students. This is an opportunity not only for the director to learn and grow in their craft but to have a profound positive impact on the lives of our future generations.
07746.title: Creative Arts Director

06854.description: Help us provide free summer reading tutoring to local students, to close the achievement gap! More than 80% of children from economically disadvantaged communities can lose one to three months’ worth of reading skills over the summer. These deficits persist and compound, resulting in an achievement gap between these students and their wealthier counterparts. This program aims to prevent the summer slide for at least 25 elementary school students so every student can succeed in school. The Homework HELP Program provides free tutoring to elementary school students at the Norwalk Public Library South Norwalk Branch. Volunteers will read short stories to students who are in grades K-3 to help build literacy and a love of reading.
06854.title: Read to Children

06854.description: Help with Childcare Family & Children’s Agency offers an array of services through its Child and Family Development Programs. In general, these programs provide support, guidance, and classes for both mothers and fathers to develop effective parenting skills and to build a strong foundation for their families. Volunteers are always needed to watch young children while moms attend their Circle of Security group or their MOMS groups. We are always needing volunteers to provide childcare for infants and toddlers. FCA runs various groups throughout the year usually once a week in the morning. We look for one or two adults to watch the children for 2 to 2.5 hours once a week. Days/times vary depending on the specific group. The number of children also varies from week to week. Family & Children’s Agency is a leading non-profit, human service organization that is committed to increasing the social and emotional well-being of our clients. We provide strength-based, solution focused services that respond to the individual needs of children & families, youth, adults, and seniors. Last year more than 10,000 individuals of all ages and all walks of life experienced life-altering, positive changes as a result of their work with Family & Children’s Agency. Requirements Volunteers must have experience with young children and complete an application and background checks, including criminal, state, and Department of Children and Families checks. Volunteers participate 2 hours a week during morning hours. Fluency in Spanish is a plus. Volunteers must also complete an Agency orientation with Volunteer Services and a program orientation with their supervisor. Skills Needed: Love for young children Patience Good judgment Dependability/consistency Cultural sensitivity/awareness Ability to maintain appropriate boundaries Clean background check
06854.title: Morning Childcare

06855.description: Passionate about healthy-style living and drug prevention? Come volunteer for the Annual Ian James Eaccarino memorial race! In memory of Ian, his parents Ginger and Larry Katz founded the Courage to Speak Foundation, dedicated to empowering youth to be drug free and encouraging parents to communicate effectively with their children about the dangers of drugs. Race volunteers will be handing out water at race stations along the course, assisting at the finish and starting lines as well as being apart of a fun filled and exciting community event. Your help will be instrumental in making the race go smoothly. If you have any questions or are interested in volunteering, please feel free to email Ginger at gkatz@couragetospeak.org or call the Courage to Speak Office at (203)831-9700 In memory of Ian or anyone that has lost their life due to drugs, please join us in promoting a healthier and drug free tomorrow! Please check out our website for more information: http://couragetospeak.org/
06855.title: Ian's Race - Help us Run to Empower Youth to Be Drug Free

11704.description: The Children’s Tumor Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to funding critical research that will one day end neurofibromatosis. In addition to benefiting those who live with NF, this research is also shedding new light on several forms of cancer, brain tumors, bone abnormalities, and learning disabilities, ultimately benefiting the broader community. The Children’s Tumor Foundation also supports people living with NF and their families with accurate, current and readily accessible information, and assists in the development of clinical centers to create better access to quality healthcare. We are in need of several committee members to join our team of NF Walk Organizers! The role of the committee member may be: To partner with and support the event chair in planning the event within the community. Help motivate, recruit and retain the participants. Communicate with the event Chair on a regular basis and be proactive in the community promoting the event. Assist with logistics and pre-event planning. Securing donations for a raffle, picnic and fundraising. Recruit and organize event-day volunteers. Assist with event-day activity planning and management and post event wrap up. Join the CTF Volunteer Team and see what a difference one person can make! Event site: https://join.ctf.org/event/2018-nf-walk-nyc/e163860
11704.title: New York Charity Walk Committee Members Needed - West Babylon

07205.description: Marketplace in Hillside is a project dedicated to battling hunger and poverty in our community. The Community FoodBank of New Jersey provides a meaningful volunteer experience in a positive, safe environment that is perfect for individuals, families, and groups of almost any size. Each year the FoodBank relies on more than 25,000 volunteers. Volunteer today and make a measurable difference in the lives of many by, helping sort and organize the food pantry, and package the items for distribution to needy families. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07205.title: Marketplace in Hillside

10523.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
10523.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Greenburgh Multiplex in Elmsford, NY!

10285.title: Serve the Community and the Environment Fridays 5PM!

We need volunteers who will be able to hang posters and drop off brochures to local places within the community (i.e., local restaurants, shops, salons, stores, eateries, banks, etc. Thank you!

08540.description: Becoming a peer support group facilitator at Good Grief is a unique, engaging, and transformative volunteer experience. Facilitators at Good Grief help to create a safe and empathic environment for grieving families after the death of a loved one by helping foster resiliency and develop healthy coping skills that will serve them for the rest of their lives. Good Grief is respected as a national leader in delivering childhood bereavement services. Since its founding in 2004, the mission of Good Grief has been to provide free and unlimited support to grieving children, teens, young adults, and their families after the death of a parent or sibling.
08540.title: Become a Peer Support Group Facilitator at Good Grief

07201.description: Every year more than half a million abused and neglected children across this country are in need of safe, permanent, nurturing homes. Too many spend years moving from one temporary home to another, and are more likely than other children to face homelessness, unemployment and even prison as adults. CASA was created to ensure the abuse and neglect these children suffered at home doesn't continue at the hands of the system. CASA trains volunteers to become advocates who are then appointed by judges to be a voice for these children in court and in their community. The goal is for each child to be placed into a safe, loving home where he/she have permanency and can thrive. Interns with CASA of Union County volunteer with our development and program staff to ensure the organization has the resources and support necessary to do this critical work. CASA of Union County seeks interns each semester to help staff continue to make CASA thrive and reach as many abused, neglected and abandoned children as possible. Some recent intern responsibilities include: Entering and analyzing case data; Organizing and prepping for special events; Developing outreach materials and engaging in community outreach; Drafting articles for newsletters; Creating social media content; Updating paper and digital case files for program staff; Attending court with staff and volunteer advocates; Preparing training materials; Assisting with volunteer recognition; and Researching opportunities to expand the volunteer base. Interns commit to working approximately 10-15 hours per week for the semester. Fall interns generally work September to December; Spring interns generally work January to May; Summer Interns generally work May to August. Start and end dates are flexible based on school schedules. To apply, please contact Lisa at 908-293-8135 or lporis@casaofunioncounty.org to request our internship application.
07201.title: Child Advocacy Summer Internship

07207.description: Serious inquirels only!! Must have 4- 6 hours max a week to give a week, be committed to our mission, and effiticely communitate witht the fournders!!!! Looking to make an impact on the world? Than join our team. Up Rising Stars Inc. is actively seeking interested and qualified individuals to join our Board of Directors. Board members advise, govern, oversee policy and direction, advocate and fundraise on behalf of us to support the organization’s mission and needs. Board members have a direct and significant impact in improving the lives of the people and families we assist. Board members must have a network and be committed to using their resources to help grow and increase revenue for the organization. The mission is to assist young people by providing them resources that will contribute to a higher education so they can achieve success. General Expectations: board members are expected to meet certain standards of board behavior and conduct as outlined below. 1. Know the vision, mission, purposes, goals, policies, programs, services, strengths and needs. 2. Term: Minimum of two years 3. Attend board meetings ( in person on via phone) 4. Keep abreast with trends in the charity sector and other factors that will affect the work us 5. Maintain independence and objectivity and exercise fairness, integrity and ethics in the execution of their duties. 6. Represent us publicly and seek to promote the image and interests whenever appropriate. 7. The board of directors meets bimonthly. Board members are expected to attend all meetings. 8. Read the minutes of meetings and supporting materials 9. Maintain confidentiality of Board meeting sessions, and support the final majority decision on issues discussed. 10. Give an annual contribution to the of 300.00 and raise 2,500- 5000 annually for the organization. Financial Responsibilities: * Be personally responsible for giving or getting at least $2,500 to $5,000 annually. This can be given personally or by getting others to give in a number of ways. All Board Members must pay dues of 300.00 annually. Qualifications: * Previous experience as a Board Member or a Board Advisor a plus. * Experience in Finance, Accounting, Fundraising, Non-Profit Management, Business Development or Management, Grant Writing, Law, or Marketing and Communications. Experience working internationally a plus. * Established professional and leader in given field of expertise with a network of contacts and ability and willingness to leverage them in support of Up Rising Stars Inc. * Passion for empowerment, entrepreneurship, education, and poverty alleviation. * Ability to attend monthly board meetings * Ability to think critically, plan strategically and remain mission-focused in all decision making processes. * Must maintain confidentiality. * Ability to execute assignments and meet deadlines. * Must have strong organizational communication, networking, commitment and follow-up skills.

11101.description: Welcome to our ESL Practice Program at The English Language Center! The ESL Practice Program needs volunteers to assist our adult English language students with one-on-two writing tutoring. Evening Writing Partners: Wednesdays and/or Thursdays, July 18th - August 23rd 5:45PM to 6:45PM 1 hour per week (6 weeks) As a writing partner (one-on-two tutoring), you would be helping students with homework from their writing and grammar classes as well as helping them improve their overall writing skills. Writing tutors should be able to assist students with English grammar and punctuation, forming paragraphs, brainstorming for ideas, organizing their writing, and using tools like the dictionary and thesaurus. Volunteers are asked to commit only one hour per week, though we are happy to have you more often if you like. Our students are very motivated and fun to work with, and they are very appreciative of any help you can give. For more information, please email: Evening Sessions: Marek Pena at mpena@lagcc.cuny.edu

11101.description: The ESL Practice Program needs volunteers to assist our adult English language students with small group conversation practice or one-on-one writing tutoring. Many of our students live with family or friends and don't get to practice these skills outside of class. Writing Partners, on the other hand, help individual students with homework from their writing and grammar classes as well as help students improve their overall writing skills. Volunteers are asked to commit only one hour per week, though we are happy to have you more often if you like. 11373.description: Help some of the over 1.1 million food insecure New Yorkers out there access nutritious food by sharing information about the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and the services Hunger Free New York City (HFNYC) provides. Embedded in communities around NYC, the HFNYC team helps screen individuals for federal nutrition assistance programs, and helps them through the application and recertification process. Community outreach is an effective way to educate fellow New Yorkers about the SNAP program and where the closet HFNYC SNAP screening sites are to them. This role is ideal for someone who is outgoing and friendly; comfortable talking to people they don’t know; enjoys being outside in different communities; and supports the mission to eliminate food insecurity in NYC. Must be 18 years old, or accompanied by someone 18 or older, and able to be outside for around 2 hours. 06880.description: CAG is seeking an individual to serve as a Board member who has background in strategic marketing, which ideally includes a blend of marketing planning and execution, with direct experience at an advertising agency or on the client side, with branding, advertising and communications experience. 11801.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Friday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Man Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .

11568.description: We are looking for a competent volunteer, should be able to motivate and inspire. You must possess organizational skills and ability to communicate with students from diverse backgrounds and experience. The goal is to ensure that our organization is always staffed with the best and most reliable individuals, and that they are correctly positioned for the fulfillment of our program and their interest. Time Commitment Before Event: 2 hrs During Event: 40 hrs After Event: 5 Hrs Duties and responsibilities Before Event Sign MOU for copy right and media responsibilities Understand program logistics and role During Event Take pictures Take Videos Upload pictures to designated organization location Pick the best pictures for the final video Help create final video Perform social media posts through program After Event Create video of the event to be posted on YouTube channel and social media Post all images in our image library online **There may be other assignments that we would need to fill in accordance to your availability, skills, and interest. Qualifications Know how to use a professional digital camera (Nikon) Basic knowledge of any video editing program and/or website People skills Understanding of group dynamics Extra: Owns a camera Know a second language that is not English Working conditions Working with students at the upper middle school and high school level. Start Date July 16, 2018
11568.title: Media Assistants Wanted for CreatingSTEAM Program

11568.description: College Students attend our programs as mentors/coaches and facilitators of the learning experience for our students. During our CreatingSTEAM program, college student mentors are assigned to student groups to assist them in navigating the projects and meeting their deadlines, acting as both a guide and a facilitator through the process. If you would like more information about our mentoring program, please contact us at info@we-connect-the-dots.org
11568.title: College Students Wanted as Mentors for CreatingSTEAM Program

11568.description: CreatingSTEAM is a 10 day experiential learning program where students gain competencies in 21st century workforce skills and awareness of STEAM career opportunities for today and in the future. Teacher volunteers and students are involved in designing and teaching the sessions or co-teaching with STEAM industry experts. As a volunteer, you will help and mentor students by being interactive and supportive during the program when the students need help. You will have the opportunity to learn along the students and inspire them to be life-long learners. Other duties might include registration, setting up and cleaning up before and after the program as needed. Do I need to have technology skills to volunteer? No, technology skills are not required, but certainly are a plus if you have them. Either way you will learn through participating with the students. The most important skill or requirement is the desire to help students learn and motivate them to be successful. You will come away with new and valuable technology skills. Our program incorporates a variety of team building activities that support our goal to engage students to work collaboratively. The result is that by volunteering you will benefit from the experience and come away with valuable skills. To learn more about the opportunity at this link: http://we-connect-the-dots.org/creatingsteam/
11568.title: Teachers, are you looking for a learning experience that is rewarding too? CreatingSTEAM

Email your resume along with a link to projects you have created.

11205.title: Volunteer Greeters

11104.description: Interpretation/Translation Volunteer at Catholic Migration Services Our Immigration program seeks volunteers to provide translation and interpretation services. Our greatest need is for persons who are bilingual in Spanish and English. This is a great opportunity for foreign language students looking to practice their language skills over the summer! Volunteer activities: Provide language interpretation services in our office. Both consecutive interpretation and simultaneous interpretation skills are welcome. Assist in our weekly Housing Intake Clinics every other Tuesday from 11-5pm by interpreting attorney-client meetings and providing general support to staff attorneys Translate foreign language documents into English. Examples of typical documents include birth certificates, affidavits, diplomas or degrees from foreign institutions, medical records, and foreign language news articles. Training will be provided. All services will be supervised by a staff attorney. For those who need to report pro bono hours, we will track the number of hours worked. Qualifications: Must be fluent in a second language to provide interpretation and translation services. Spanish- English skills are in greatest demand. Court certification is not required. Commit to at least 3 housing intake clinics which take place every other Tuesday from 11-5 p.m. in our Queens office Who We Are: Founded in 1971, Catholic Migration Services is committed to \"welcoming the stranger in our midst,\" by empowering underserved immigrant communities in Brooklyn and Queens. We provide high quality legal services, know-your-rights education, and advocacy to immigrants to advance equality and social justice in a changing and diverse population. Our services are available without regard to national origin, religion or immigration status. Catholic Migration Services is a not-for-profit corporation with 501(c)(3) status and affiliated with Catholic Charities Brooklyn and Queens and the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn. Site: Tenant Advocacy Program language assistance volunteers may work at our Queens office located at 47-01 Queens Blvd, Suite 201, Sunnyside, NY 11104. Contact: Katie Searle, Volunteer Coordinator Email: ksearle@catholicmigration.org Phone: (718) 236-3000 ext. 204
11104.title: ARE YOU BILINGUAL? Volunteer this Summer as a Legal Interpreter/Translator!

11104.description: The Senior Center provides around 200 meals a day to seniors. Volunteers will provide assistance in the senior center dining room and kitchen for lunch service, which includes food preparation, distribution and clean up. WHAT WILL I BE DOING? Under the direction of the kitchen supervisor you might be: Wrapping silverware Preparing components of the meals Serving meals Providing table service Assisting with clean up Washing dishes/pots and pans Wiping down tables Signing in Seniors YOUR QUALITIES: Commitment and Consistent Considerate and patient Available Mondays through Fridays 9am to 2pm Work well with staff, volunteers, and clients Ability to communicate effectively Sensitive to diverse cultures Food handler OR OSHA certified preferred but not mandatory
11104.title: Help Serve Lunch to Seniors at Sunnyside!

11206.description: Mentoring Kids Through Tennis Kings County Tennis League (KCTL) is a registered 501c3 non-profit that uses tennis as an instrument for mentorship and community building in Bedford Stuyvesant, Brooklyn. We literally bring tennis to the children’s communities. KCTL is seeking enthusiastic individuals who are comfortable working with kids and ready to develop their roles as mentors.Tennis skills are helpful, but not required. For the summer season, our free classes are Saturday mornings, June 2 through September 22, at the following sites in Bedford Stuyvesant, BK: Lafayette Gardens, Marcy, Sumner, Tompkins and Jackie Robinson. Volunteers must commit to a minimum number of classes. Duties for each class included: tossing tennis balls, giving out high fives, directing and communicating with students, and teaching If you have a tennis background. Basically, however, you will serve as a positive role model that the kids look forward to seeing each day. All volunteers are required to undergo a background check and training. Volunteers will receive a KCTL team jersey and invites to special volunteer events as a thanks for all their hard work. Please fill out a KCTL registration form if you’re interested, or contact rob@kingscountytennisleague.org.
11206.title: Mentor Kids through After-School Tennis

11208.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11208.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Linden Blvd Multiplex in Brooklyn, NY!

10024.description: Love seniors? Love giving makeovers? Attend a makeover at Phelps House with our intern chapter this summer! No experience necessary! Just bring yourself and a positive attitude. GlamourGals is a nonprofit that organizes and inspires teen volunteers to provide ongoing companionship and complimentary beauty makeovers to women living in senior homes. GlamourGals creates a movement of compassionate teen leaders working to end elder isolation. Chapters are student-led and based in high schools (grades 9-12) and universities. We currently have over 100 chapters across the country. What you can do as a volunteer: Connect with seniors in your local community and improve their overall wellbeing Participate in makeovers to help seniors feel young again Provide seniors with a restored sense of dignity through personal attention and the warmth of caring touch Gain the opportunity to listen to and share their stories Bridge the gap between generations in your community What you will gain as a volunteer: Develop confidence and have the opportunity to take on leadership roles Gain access to mentorship opportunities, interactive skill-building workshops, and professional development training Improve your interpersonal and communication skills through interacting with seniors Receive support, guidance, and materials from the GlamourGals National Office for senior home visits Time Commitment: Join us whenever you can this summer for a 1.5 hour makeover visit Our scheduled visits will take place on: June 27 July 18 and 25 August 1 and 8 Visits take place at 1:00 - 2:30pm at Phelps House (Goddard Riverside Community Center) Check out our website to find out more about us! www.glamourgals.org Read our weekly blog posts about our volunteers' stories from their GlamourGals experiences! www.glamourgals.org/blog/
10024.title: NYC Senior Home Visit/Makeover

Volunteers will help lead tasks like reviewing resumes and giving tips, practicing interview skills and much more. Don't worry, we'll prepare you to be ready before you meet with clients! And if you have materials or resources you would like to share, please come ready to present them. If you don't have anything prepared, that's ok too. 07950.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary

10701.description: Volunteers should expect to work with several children during each 2 hour session. The children will have selected a book and then be matched up with a volunteer. After introductions the \"buddies\" will find a spot where they can work together for 20 minutes. The volunteer will encourage the student to read, help with specific words, pronunciation and comprehension. When they’ve finished the book the volunteer will help the child complete a worksheet. We give out \"passports\" to every child who registers for Summer Reading Buddies and each child gets a stamp on his passport for each day they attend. The volunteer will then bring the child back to our staff who will match them up with their next \"buddy\". Summer Reading Buddies volunteer opportunties are also available at the Ossining Public Library. Please contact us for further information. Everyone enjoys this program. Take a look at coverage by WPIX 11: http://www.jcy-wcp.com/summermediacraze.html

07940.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. The Editor is responsible for reviewing articles submitted by The Borgen Project’s national team of writers. Editors will also perform edits for articles appearing on BORGEN Magazine and The Borgen Project Blog. Our volunteer position is a part-time, work from home role. You can set your own schedule and specify how many hours per week you wish to work. - Edit and format articles submitted by national writers. - Work with writers to improve their articles. Qualifications: Must have great editing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision.
