11213.description: Seeds in the Middle and our Hip2B Healthy Project are showing kids and families how to grow food and cook healthy - We joining with the SUNY Downstate Fun Health Day on Saturday, July 21 - offering fresh juices and healthy snacks. We'd love to have a chef or even someone who just loves to cook fresh and healthy and who loves kids to do two demos - all supplies included - of anything healthy he or she would like to share. Must: use fresh ingredients conduct demo at 11:30 am conduct demo at 1:30 pm contact us at info@seedsinthemiddle.org or tastesofbrooklyn@gmail.com We take all ideas and have worked with chefs for our signature Chef Nights in schools, where chefs work with students to create gourmet, nutritious dinners for the same cost as a fast food combo and then SERVE their elders (parents, faculty, community). Even if you can only do one demo, let us know. We will have assistants for you and we will thank you far and wide. Our social media reaches thousands.
11213.title: Chefs! Show kids how to cook healthy, Sat. July 21, 11-3p

11213.description: Love soccer? Want to share the joy of the game with underserved kids in central Brooklyn? Join us for this exciting opportuntiy to build a brand new league for youth who need it in Crown Heights! We need players to coach kids ages 3 and up and help lead teams. Most children have never played soccer and some come back every season - so there's a variety of levels. This is a neighborhood with limited healthy options - to eat or get physically fit. So, you'll play a role in not only building teamwork, but empowering youth and families to get active. Seeking anyone who can play soccer or support the program starting now through end of summer. Weekends - Saturdays and Sundays. Thursday evenings also possible. Have fun, play ball, make a difference. Attn, Students! Yes, we give community service credits. Our program started in 2009 just to get kids active. Now, we want to expand a nascent league. . Kids love it, but don't know the game so we need your help. We're also seeking LEAD COACHES, who can set up schedules and organize volunteers and parents. Great experience. Recommendation letters given. Can you play in a fundraising opening soccer game? We can schedule in March! SCHEDULE - April 21 - June 23 APRIL 21 - JUNE 23 SATURDAYS, 1 PM - 3 PM SUNDAYS, 4 PM - 6 PM INFO: No coaching experience needed. Just love of the game and able to collaborate with others. Of course, we'd love it if you have experience... Practices are co-ed, and players range from 3 to 12 years old and are at beginner to intermediate level. If we have enough players, will create boys and girls only teams for ages 10 and up.. If you're self-motivated, love kids and are good with them, can handle the unexpected, and just love this game and want to share it, you're for us. Looking for reliable and flexible players who can commit to at least 2 practices. This is a great community service opportunity for high school and college students. Yes, we do give letters and service hours. WE ASK VOLUNTEERS TO COMMIT TO AT LEAST 2 TIMES ON THE FIELD. If you aren't able to coach, but still want to help, we need folks to: - advertise with flyers, post flyers, drop off flyers at schools and community areas - blast on social media - take attendance and register players - other administrative tasks Please send us information about you- a resume or some information on your background so we get to know you a little to soccer@seedsinthemiddle.org If you have other times you are available - even to do a workshop in a school, let us know. YOU CAN ALSO LIKE US ON FACEBOOK - facebook.com/seedsinthemiddle https://www.facebook.com/brooklyncrown.heightssoccer https://www.facebook.com/Soccer-for-Harmony-204551942961230/ Instagram: @seedsinthemiddle
11213.title: Soccer Players!  Share joy of game, help NEW league for Brooklyn  kids!

11216.description: Calling all RUNNERS... interested in entering the 2018 TCS NYC Marathon but were not chosen in the lottery? You still can! Children of Promise, NYC (CPNYC), a nonprofit that embraces and empowers children of incarcerated parents, has slots for marathon runners on our 10-person team. To learn more about the benefits of running with Team CPNYC, which includes guaranteed entry into the race, please visit: https://www.cpnyc.org/marathon Run for a reason and raise awareness for a population of children who have an incarcerated parent! ABOUT CPNYC CPNYC is a community-based organization in Brooklyn working to ensure children left behind by prisoners are empowered to break the cycle of intergenerational incarceration and imagine futures bigger and brighter than their current circumstances. All funds raised will go directly toward program support and much needed therapeutic supplies and interventions.
11216.title: Run the 2018 TCS NYC Marathon!

07306.description: CASA volunteers are ordinary people - men and women, retirees and busy professionals - who have the opportunity to directly influence a foster child's life across many significant and far-reaching concerns such as medical care, academics, and enrichment activities. We are looking for individuals with a desire to help children in need of one-on-one attention. The first step to becoming a volunteer is to attend an information session. Please join us for a half-hour to learn how you can make a difference in a foster child's life.
07306.title: Hudson County CASA Information Session

11214.description: We are looking for a Yoga Instructor to teach a group of high school students at New Utrecht HS in Brooklyn. The dates are 7/9 - 8/3 Mons. and Weds. from 11:30am-1pm. We can provided MTA travel expenses.
11214.title: Yoga Instructor

11215.description: We are looking for committed volunteers for our school programs! This spring we have two school programs volunteers can help support us with. Our Citizen Science program emphasizes the role of citizen scientists and the importance of advocating for our waterways. Citizen Science program volunteers will become familiar with water quality testing parameters, protocols and help lead groups of students through different tests. Our service-learning program introduces students to the Gowanus Canal, its polluted history and the steps to making a healthier ecosystem through stewardship. Service Learning program volunteers will engage students in stewardship activities - such as gardening, caring for street trees, and propagating plants in our native plant nursery. This is perfect for volunteers that are interested or have prior experience in education. No prior knowledge on topics or activities are needed. Programs are reserved are for Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Based on their availability and interest volunteers can help with one program or both. Volunteers must be able to commit to regularly volunteering throughout the spring season- April till June. Please email education@gowanuscanalconservancy.org if you are interested in one or both school programs.
11215.title: Ongoing Education Volunteer

10035.description: Groove With Me 2018 Summer Program: We are currently accepting applications for Volunteer Dance Teachers for our Summer Grooves Program at Groove With Me, Inc. Groove With Me is a free dance school for girls (ages 4-18) in East Harlem. We engage girls during the idle out-of-school hours when 90% of youth violence occurs; and we seek to decrease teen pregnancy, truancy, crime, violence, prostitution, substance abuse and gang related activity. East Harlem has the highest unmet need for after school programming of any neighborhood in NYC. By volunteering you will provide much needed out-of-school time safety - and arts programming. At Groove With Me, we strive to provide a forum for girls to develop critical thinking skills as well as a growth mindset through Dance. Summer Programming 2018 Schedule Will Offer 2 Sessions: Classes meet 1x per week for 1 hour Session 1 will run from July 2th - July 26th (4 weeks) Session 2 will run from July 30th- August 16th (3 weeks) Teachers can select which session to teach. If you are interested in this opportunity, please give me a call at 212-987-5910 or reach me via email at beatriz@groovewithme.org Beatriz Coronel, MA Program Director Groove With Me, Inc. 186 E 123rd St NY, NY 10035 Phone: 212-987-5910 Fax: 212-987-5080 www.groovewithme.org
10035.title: Volunteer Dance Teachers Needed For A Youth Development Dance Program (Groove With Me)

10037.description: Live Healthy! is looking for a few volunteers to be a part of their Greenmarket Nutrition Workshop and Culinary Demos team. Three times a week with 2 shift options including morning shift (9 am - 12 pm) or afternoon shift (1 pm-3 pm). Live Healthy! provides nutrition workshops on how to increase fruits and vegetable intake while providing a delicious and nutritious recipe demo that includes ingredients found right at the farmers' market. Volunteers are needed to help with set-up, break-down, and overall management of the workshops. Someone with a can do attitude, who's ready to take the initiative, and who thoroughly enjoys interacting with people as a representative of NYCP in the community would be an ideal candidate. It's a team effort out at the Greenmarket, and each person plays a vital role! Volunteers must be at least 16 years or older, be able to lift at least 30 lbs, and be comfortable in a variety of outdoor environments.
10037.title: Join NYCP's Nutrition Education Team at the Farmers' Market!

10036.description: NFTE's Startup Summer program is a small business incubator that provides 20 high school students with the resources and support to launch fully functional businesses. During the six-week intensive program, student entrepreneurs work to launch their businesses utilizing the iterative framework established by Eric Ries’ The Lean Startup methodology. For this opportunity, we are recruiting 50 volunteers as Startup Summer BusinessAdvisors. As a BusinessAdvisor, you and 1-2 other volunteer advisors will work together with a student entrepreneur to help take their business to the next level - from ideation to actually launching and making sales! Because it is over the summer and students get paid, the overall \"feel\" of the program is professional, and expectations are high. The time commitment is as follows: Program Activity Details Startup Summer Mixer This is the first event where the student entrepreneurs meet their businessadvisors, they share their business ideas, and get to know more about their businessadvisors Date: Thursday, June 27, 2018 Time: 6:00-8:00pm Location: Citi, 601 Lexington Ave. Business Advising Sessions Each week, we provide a structured guide on upcoming deliverables that the students have to complete and how to help them make important decisions that will help progress their business forward Dates: Wednesdays: 7/18, 7/25, 8/1 and Tuesday 8/14 Time: 6:00-8:00pm Location: EY, 5 Times Square Advisory Panel Event All 20 student entrepreneurs will present on the progress of their businesses in front of a panel of esteemed business professionals. The top 3 student entrepreneurs will pitch the following week for additional startup capital Date: Wednesday, August 8, 2018 Time: 5:00-8:00pm Location: EY, 5 Times Square Investment Panel Event This is the culminating event of the summer program where the 3 top-performing student entrepreneurs pitch for a part of $10,000 in additional seed capital; all student entrepreneurs attend this final event Date: Thursday, August 16, 2018 Time: 6:30-8:30pm Location: TBA Optional: Happy Hours On a couple of occasions after the advising sessions, we'll walk over to Beer Authority and grab a drink or two to network and get to know one another better
10036.title: Business Advisor for Startup Summer 6-week Incubator Program

10036.description: You will have a great time meeting as many people as possible at various events and inviting them to upcoming productions that make a difference and begin crucial conversations.
10036.title: Fun social butterfly volunteering!

10036.description: Help rescue some lunch leftovers from an office in Midtown West! We will deliver the food to Travelers Hotel, located at 274 W 40th street. Mediumweight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is 30-45 pounds.
10036.title: End Food Waste and Feed the Hungry Fridays 3PM!

10030.description: Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org) is a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to love reading. Through our rich, innovative programs, accomplished authors visit high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms, where they guide students in creating their own writing projects based on the theme of the author's book. BtB seeks volunteer photographers and videographers to document students, authors, and volunteer coaches during classroom workshops and field trips. It's ideal if you have experience working with pre-K to high school-age students. You may also cover fundraising and other events. Examples of photos can be found on our Instagram feed at www.instagram.com/behindthebook/. To apply, or for more information, contact volunteer@behindthebook.org. Please include a link to your website, portfolio or other samples of your work in either or both areas.
10030.title: Photographer/Videography

10030.description: Future Giants is a non profit that has operated in NYC for over 11 years. We specialize in preparing High School students for the social and academic challenges they will encounter after graduation. We have a 100 college acceptance rate and a 99 % on time High School Graduation rate. Last year we created and published a High school book that is being used in several High Schools. We are seeking Volunteers that have a direct or indirect contact with the Mayors of Baltimore and or D.C. It is our hope to recreate our success in those cities as well as open our first multi organization youth center (A.C.E) Future Giants is planning to Launch our Academic + Community = Excellence If you have any contacts with the Mayors of either Baltimore ,MD or D.C ( or the Governor) we would like your assistance in helping thousands of young people achieve their dreams.
10030.title: Reference to Mayor of D.C. and or Baltimore

10033.description: Food pantry volunteers are needed in Washington Heights. The pantry is open Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. This client choice food pantry serves New Yorkers in need. Volunteers will assist clients in choosing food and help keep the pantry stocked. Volunteers must be comfortable with light to moderate lifting and movement.
10033.title: Washington Heights Food Pantry Volunteer

07041.description: Dear Residents of Millburn Township School Do you want to make a difference in a young person's life; while you learn about another culture, create and build friendships and make ever-lasting memories? Do you have a caring heart and extra space in your home? AnB Education is looking for you! Make a difference today and host an international student! All our students need is: A Private bedroom with a desk, bed and dresser 2 meals a day on school days and 3 meals a day on non school days Transportation to and from school if there is no school buses provided Please contact AnB Headquarters office at: 267.263.2481 or email to contact@anbeducation.com Company website: www.anbeducation.com
07041.title: Volunteer Host Families for International students

11212.description: Do you believe every child and family deserve the right to buy and eat fresh produce and healthy food at affordable prices? Are you into food justice and do you believe healthy eating is a civil right? Then, work with students, parents, educators and the community to build school-run Hip2B Healthy Market/Farmstand/Fleas in Brownsville, Brooklyn and in Flatbush, Brooklyn. Both these neighborhoods are ranked among NYC's most food-insecure zones, by the NYC Health Dept. and multiple studies. There is limited access to fruits and vegetables and overwhelming junk food options. These neighborhoods have among the highest obesity, diabetes, heart disease rates in the city - mainly due to lack of access to affordable fresh produce and healthy activities. Be the change! Seeking volunteers on these days! Choose any: In school, working with elementary and/or middle school students (btw 8 am and 3 pm, hours optional) - Tuesdays am - Help prep market in Flatbush (hours flexible) - - Wednesday am - Help run market - 7 -10 am (and offer any special cooking, recipes, etc.) - Thursdays - any time all day in Brownsville (help prep for market and cook with kids) - Friday am (Brownsville) - 7-10 am - Help run market and other activities - Saturdays, 9-3 pm (Brownsville) - Help run market and do activities with kids and families, including yoga, fitness like zumba, art, tutor, cook healthy recipes, etc. Do you garden? Do you want to help children grow food as well? Let us know. Looking for anyone who wants to work with students and families and educators and the local commuity to effect sustainable change by building local capacity. All talents and skills welcome - even an hour-long yoga class. Yes, we give internships (and welcome students of all ages to get community service credits, internship credits, etc.) Can you cook healthy? Please offer a recipe, a demo or class, whatever you'd like to share. We can schedule together and we will promote your business. Want to join a new flea? Have a home business and want to get more exposure? Join us. WE LAUNCH BROWNSVILLE ON FEB. 3 AND FLATBUSH ON MARCH 7. Saturday Market: Set-up: 9-10 am Activities: 10 am - 2 pm Breakdown: 2-3 pm School days - we arrange with you. Do you cook or want to share a healthy recipe that day? Even hot oatmeal or smoothies? Then help us run our Hip2B Healthy Markets.. No experience necessary - just a passion for healthy food and sharing nutrition and a quality life with all. Do you want to lead a healthy workshop - even with friends? A cooking demo or a dance class? In health profession? Can you do blood pressure screenings, offer nutrition or diabetes education or more? Anything more? Please join us. Parents are asking! You can also offer any kind of physical activity - dance, zumba, soccer, yoga - just for an hour in the gym. Seeds in the Middle is a joyful partnership with volunteers and communities to have fun while getting healthy and empowering kids to create their own healthy environments, when there's nothing around them. Central Brooklyn is one of 3 neighborhoods with the highest obesity, diabetes and heart disease rates - due to lack of accessible, affordable fresh food and fitness. Let's change that together. Everyone is welcome. All ages welcome, families, too! Students - get community service credits. And let us know if you want to continue to volunteer for Saturday markets! More info? Email - info@seedsinthemiddle.org
11212.title: Food! Health! Help Brownsville, Flatbush BK kids launch healthy market days!

07738.description: Volunteer for iCan Bike, a program that teaches individuals with disabilities to independently ride a conventional two wheel bicycle over the course of five days. Volunteers, aged 16 or older serve as spotters for the riders, walking/light jogging alongside their camper. They help the rider to learn, keep their balance, steer, and most of all offer encouragement and motivation. The same two spotters work with the same child all week, so they truly share in the pride and joy of their success at the end of the week!! From increasing self esteem, to more inclusion in the community, to more physical fitness, to independent transportation, you will be helping these individuals in countless ways! Check it out: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5d82gFzxJOw&feature
07738.title: Help a child with a disability learn to ride a bike!
07738.org: iCan Bike! (formerly Lose The Training Wheels)

07430.description: ENROLLMENT FOR VOLUNTEERS FOR PONY POWER THERAPIES SUMMER SEMESTER IS NOW OPEN! Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as lead walkers for our Summer Semester! Lead walkers are responsible for handling the horse during lessons and only those with previous horse experience will be assigned as Lead Walkers. Lessons run Monday through Thursday. Our Summer Semester begins on Monday, June 25th and runs through to August 23rd. Morning sessions: 8:45 to 10:45AM (except June 25th to 28th: 8:45AM to 12:15PM) Afternoon sessions: 2:30 to 6:00PM Volunteer Handbook, application and schedule will be emailed to you and application needs to be returned to our office prior to registering for a volunteer training class. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.
07430.title: Horse Handler Volunteers for Afternoons in Summer Semester at Pony Power Therapies!

07733.description: Hi volunteers! Here are the details for this exciting opportunity to work with Musicians Against Gun Violence at our table at the Vans Warped Tour: Event volunteers will be given a pass to the festival and provided a meal in exchange for their work engaging the lines into the venue and at our table in the Warped tent. Responsibilities will include clearly conveying our mission to attendees, discussing the raffle and pledge drive with interested parties, processing and recording donations and donor info, and occasionally mitigating conflict with hardline 2A'ers where necessary. To be considered for this gig, you must be passionate and knowledgeable about common sense gun control legislation as well as comfortable and adept at de-escalating tense exchanges with folks opposed to our mission (as there WILL be some). Comfort with using a bullhorn is a plus! Transportation and overnight accommodation are not provided (but local pick-ups can be arranged). You will have the opportunity to catch some acts as the Warped tent breaks down at 6pm and the show goes for hours beyond that. Cheers and thanks for reading!
07733.title: Volunteer at Warped Tour with Musicians Against Gun Violence!

07733.description: Do you want to volunteer at the Vans Warped Tour in your city? Are you passionate about youth empowerment and exercising your right to vote? Then sign up to volunteer with I’m Down To Vote at your local date of the final cross-country Vans Warped Tour! We are looking for 2 volunteers per date to help us encourage young people 13+ to commit to voting when they turn 18! Please note we are strictly non-partisan and do not represent any political parties. We have one agenda: To encourage everyone eligible to vote! Additionally, you will be talking with Warped Tour attendees and also be helping with day-of promotion of the tent. If interested, please fill out this form! http://imdowntovote.org/volunteer-with-us/
07733.title: Vans Warped Tour I'm Down To Vote Volunteer - Holmdel, NJ

11554.description: We are having our second annual BBQ to support breast cancer comfort. Last year we had fun and we are looking to have a great time this year! We are looking for volunteers to help setup and breakdown, help with guests, help with games, and have fun!
11554.title: Summer BBQ Help!

11554.description: We are having a summer BBQ to support breast cancer comfort and looking for a face painter to volunteer their time. This is our second annual BBQ and looking to have lots more fun this year!!!
11554.title: Face Painter for Breast Cancer Summer BBQ

11357.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 69th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Friday, June 8 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Man Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11357.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at College Point Multiplex in Whitestone, NY!

11355.description: The YWCA of Queens Mobile Food Pantry distributes free, fresh fruit and vegetables to anyone in need in our community. Volunteers sort and bag fresh produce, assist with intake/enrollment process, distribute food to families and help with clean up at the end of event. Breakfast and lunch will be provided to volunteers
11355.title: Mobile Food Pantry

11590.description: Community Connections of Long Island, Inc. is a community-based non-profit organization operating a youth-staffed market that provides fresh, affordable Long Island produce to residents of New Cassel, Westbury and surrounding areas. The project replicates a popular model developed by Sustainable Long Island and now facilitated by Northwell/Long Island Green Markets which also provides technical assistance to the market. This model allows local teens to earn important business and customer service skills through job training and employment while providing the community at large with fruits and vegetables from local Long Island farms. New Cassel Farmers' Market is seeking ten high school aged students from Westbury/New Cassel to work with the community youth farmers markets throughout the 2018 summer and fall seasons. Selected students will be expected to participate in weekly markets, promote and publicize market activities, and work under the direct supervision of a market manager; who will run the farm stands on behalf of local farmers.
11590.title: Farmers' Market Volunteer
11590.org: Community Connections of Long Island, Inc./New Cassel Farmers' Market

11217.description: READ 718 is a non-profit literacy center that provides tutoring and literacy workshops to low-income students in grades 3-8. We are looking for dedicated, reliable, caring, positive people who are committed to working with a child at least one hour a week, from July 5-25 . On average, students lose two months of reading skills over the summer, and they start the academic year with achievement levels lower than where they were at the beginning of summer break . This phenomenon is referred to as summer slide. READ 718’s Summer Reading Room is intended to keep kids engaged and reading over the summer in order to prevent this setback. Literacy Tutor Requirements: excellent literacy and communication skills must be at least 18 years of age and have high school diploma available for a minimum of one hour a week on Mondays, Tuesdays, and/or Wednesdays Time slots: 3:00-4:00pm, 4:00-5:00pm, or 5:00-600pm (tutors can volunteer for up to 3 hours a day) experience with children and/or adolescents interest in literacy education practices positive, collaborative attitude must agree to background check must attend one, 2.5-hour training session APPLICATION: Please fill out the application on our website at www.read718.org and contact Program Coordinator, Alice Walker at alice@read718.org with any questions. Once we receive your application, we will send you a scheduling form.
11217.title: Seeking Volunteer Tutors for July 2018

11217.description: The Human Resource Assistant position at A Free Bird provides support to the HR Director for all HR administrative processes. The role will be responsible with assisting with recruitment, onboarding, and researching information pertaining to the Human Resources Department. The Volunteer/Intern will maintain records and information for the business. The assistant will schedule appointments, have the ability to work independently and within a team environment; ability to efficiently organize materials and information, ability to easily adjust to changing conditions, maintain effective working relationships with employees an individuals. Responsibilities: -Creating spreadsheets & documents within google drive and Microsoft office. -Assisting with Calendar appointments -Scheduling and participating in interviews -Recruitment & Onboarding of new team members -Organizing and updating documents relating to HR - Creating a pool of volunteers and interns - Updating and posting of jobs online - Evaluating resumes as per job descriptions -Communicating with volunteers/interns and outside representatives as required Competencies: -Working towards/completed a qualification in Human Resources -Ability to maintain confidentiality at all times -Understanding of Google Drive -Understanding of Microsoft Office Suite - PowerPoint, Excel & Word -Highly organized and professional
11217.title: HR Assistant

07960.description: We are beginning to recruit interested volunteers for our upcoming New Jersey Confidential Sexual Violence Victim Advocate (CSVA) training, which is slated to begin in July 2018 (5 Weeks, Tuesdays and Thursday from 6PM-10PM). During the 40 hour training volunteers are educated about topics regarding sexual assault statistics, prevention, and response. Crisis intervention and advocacy support skills are taught and guest speakers, including law enforcement, military experts, and mental health professionals present information. When the volunteer completes the training and receives the CSVA status, they are required to manage the crisis hotline for three 12 hour shifts per month. (The hotline is forwarded to the volunteer's telephone for their shifts.) In addition to hotline, the advocate's second responsibility per shift is to accompany survivors of sexual assault to the hospital as needed. Although this is a challenging volunteer position, the experience is very rewarding (and looks great on a resume too)! Join our team and support survivors!
07960.title: Sexual Assault Response Team Advocate Training

07960.description: Becoming a peer support group facilitator at Good Grief is a unique, engaging, and transformative volunteer experience. Facilitators at Good Grief help to create a safe and empathic environment for grieving families after the death of a loved one by helping foster resiliency and develop healthy coping skills that will serve them for the rest of their lives. Good Grief is respected as a national leader in delivering childhood bereavement services. Since its founding in 2004, the mission of Good Grief has been to provide free and unlimited support to grieving children, teens, young adults, and their families after the death of a parent or sibling.
07960.title: Become a peer support facilitator!

Good Grief is respected as a national leader in delivering childhood bereavement services. Since its founding in 2004, the mission of Good Grief has been to provide free and unlimited support to grieving children, teens, young adults, and their families after the death of a parent or sibling.
07960.title: Become a Peer Support Group Facilitator at Good Grief

10460.description: There is a tremendous need, especially for high-risk youth in low-income neighborhoods in The Bronx municipality, for programs that provide activities and support for children during the after school hours and throughout the summer and ACN has stepped up to take the responsibility in addressing this problem through our new initiative (ACN YOUTH CAPACITY BUILDING) Project. In 1998, the Children’s Defense Fund reported that violent crime by young people ages 10-17 peaks between 3 and 7 PM; children and teens in poor neighborhoods are struggling for direction and positive opportunities are needed to keep them safe and on-track; a great majority of all American fourth graders cannot read or do math at grade level, including more than five of six black children. In addition, a study published in Pediatrics magazine found that eighth graders who were left alone after school reported greater use of cigarettes, marijuana, and alcohol than those in adult-supervised settings. Current research indicates that supervised after-school and summer programs not only keep children safe and out of trouble, they also significantly improve their academic achievement. PROJECT DESCRIPTION Teaching high-risk, inner-city Youth the skills to become successful in life is at the core of the ACN SUMMER YOUTH CAPACITY BUILDING program. The Four(4) major components of the program are: *Homework Assistance through tutoring, mentoring and Use of Computer labs. *Nutrition Education to promote healthy lifestyles and Combat Obesity. *Life Skills which are integrated throughout all phases of the program. *Soccer Instructions where participants engage in fun physical fitness, enjoy the camaraderie of playing in a soccer team format with friends and peers, and learn to become responsible adolescents and adults. The summer After-School Program- will serve approximately 600 children which includes academic tutoring five(5) hours per week and Soccer Instruction, Health and life skills education ten(10) hours per week. Participants will receive Soccer Instruction in professional settings and practice skills in team format play. They will learn about the rules of the game, etiquette, sportsmanship, positive attitudes, fair play, self-esteem, taking responsibility for choices and management of emotions. These life skills are integrated throughout the Soccer program, and instructors routinely demonstrate how they apply to situations in all aspects of life. Nutrition and Healthy lifestyles are stressed both in the Classroom setting and on the Soccer Field. Healthy Snacks will be provided. The ACN YOUTH CAPACITY BUILDING program is Fortunate to have a corpse of Volunteers willing to dedicate to the program and are available to work with the children on improving their academic skills. Seeking Volunteers from some of the community based Universities/colleges who will take an active role in the homework area, working individually with the students using current homework assignments. In the computer lab, Volunteer tutors will help the students improve their keyboarding skills and show them how to use the computer for research. They will read aloud with the students and give quizzes on tapes and videos to improve comprehension. When the college/university students volunteers are not on campus, volunteers from local Churches will assume the role of tutors. Incentives will be awarded to the participants based on attendance, good behavior and general attitude.
10460.title: ACN YOUTH CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT

07028.description: Dear Residents of Glen Ridge Public Schools Do you want to make a difference in a young person's life; while you learn about another culture, create and build friendships and make ever-lasting memories? Do you have a caring heart and extra space in your home? AnB Education is looking for you! Make a difference today and host an international student! All our students need is: A Private bedroom with a desk, bed and dresser 2 meals a day on school days and 3 meals a day on non school days Transportation to and from school if there is no school buses provided Please contact AnB Headquarters office at: 267.263.2481 or email to contact@anbeducation.com Company website: www.anbeducation.com
07028.title: Volunteer Host Families for International students

10304.description: City Harvest is in high need of volunteers at our Thursday, July 5th Stapleton Mobile Market! Help distribute fresh produce, free of charge, in an open-air market setting to hundreds of families of need! Volunteers will be stationed at 3-4 market tables, each supplied with thousands of pounds of fresh fruits and vegetables that they will help distribute to eligible market-goers. As the market-goers stop by each table, volunteers greet them and then weigh and bag the produce. The Mobile Markets take place outdoors, rain or shine. We stress that it's important to wear comfortable, weather appropriate clothes. As this is a very hands-on activity and there is no secure place to leave your property, it is recommended that you travel light, i.e., personal belongings should be left at home/office or a messenger bag/backpack should be used. All volunteers should arrive promptly at 8:45am. Your promptness ensures that we will be able to start the Mobile Market on time. If you are running late, please contact the market manager (number below). The market should end around 12pm. First time volunteers will not need to attend an orientation for this special, high need project! Volunteers must be 18 years or older and must register on City Harvest's Volunteer Portal. Be sure to plan your travel in advance, especially if you are unfamiliar with the area. Use Google maps and check the MTA website for any service changes or delays the day of the event.
10304.title: Stapleton Mobile Market Food Distribution

Help distribute fresh produce, free of charge, in an open-air market setting to hundreds of families of need! Volunteers will be stationed at 3-4 market tables, each supplied with thousands of pounds of fresh fruits and vegetables that they will help distribute to eligible market-goers. As the market-goers stop by each table, volunteers greet them and then weigh and bag the produce. The Mobile Markets take place outdoors, rain or shine. 10301.description: We are Community Agency for Senior Citizens, Inc. We have been in Staten Island for over 40 years. We only serve Older Adults. The program is called the Friendly Visiting Program. The program began in January/2017. We look to \"Match\" you with an Older Adult. The program asks that you spend one hour in the Client's home. While visiting the Client, you can have a cup of coffee/tea, play a table top game, cards, read a book together, watch a movie. The visit is what you both decide upon. This is a building block relationship. So far, many of our \"Match's\" have become good friends and look forward to these weekly visits.
10301.title: Do You Want to Brighten Someone's Day? Volunteer's Are the Sunshine that Homebound Adult's Need
10301.org: COMMUNITY AGENCY FOR SENIOR CITIZENS INC

07701.description: Data entry volunteers needed for approximately 7-10 hours a week. Approximately 3 hours per week will take place in Lunch Break's administrative office (121 Drs. James Parker Blvd. in Red Bank) and the rest can be from your home. Date/time of in-office work is flexible, can work with your schedule. Some data entry/computer experience is helpful. Training will be provided. Looking to start ASAP!
07701.title: Data Entry Volunteers

10029.description: We're looking for several people to volunteer with our Meals on Wheels program on Saturday, July 7th! We welcome both individual volunteers and small groups. For over 40 years, Union Settlement has provided Meals on Wheels to East Harlem's older residents that are often economically struggling and living alone. Our Meals on Wheels program currently serves approximately 450 homebound seniors each day. Prior to the volunteer date, volunteers will be sent a short training video and brief quiz to help prepare them for participation with Meals on Wheels. Volunteers will help pack hot and cold meals and then join staff on deliveries where they will get to hand out meals to our clients and interact with the East Harlem community. Volunteers are not required to have a driver's license or own a car. When: Saturday, July 7th from 8:30am to 12:30pm Where: Jefferson Senior Center in East Harlem Interested individuals or groups should email volunteers@unionsettlement.org with the subject line \"Saturday, July 7th Meals on Wheels Volunteer\".
10029.title: Volunteer with Meals on Wheels on Saturday, July 7th!

10029.description: DREAM, an award winning youth development program, is seeking volunteer T-ball coaches to work with youth ages 5-7 in practices and games. Coaches teach T-ball and provide youth with opportunities to play, learn and grow; inspiring them to recognize their potential and realize their dreams. Each coach serves as a member of a small coaching staff. There are powerful rewards gained from the DREAM coaching experience. DREAM volunteer coaches can have a direct and noticeable impact on the positive development of the youth they coach. The ideal candidate is passionate about youth development, has experience working with youth, and can commit to attending six Saturday practices and games in July/August, as well as a one-day pre-season coaches training in June. Roles and Responsibilities: Guide a team of 16-18 youth through practices and games; Ensure youth safety on the field; Provide a fun and positive, team-based environment; Attend all practices and games on six Saturdays in July and August. Qualifications: Passionate about youth development; Understand the power of teamwork; Have the ability to create a positive, team-based environment focused on teaching T-ball; Organized, energetic and flexible; Skilled communicators; Experience in baseball/softball a plus; Able to commit to six Saturdays, in July and August; At least 18 years of age. Hours: Coaches conduct practices and games for an hour and a half on six Saturday mornings or afternoons from 7/7/18 to 8/11/18. Coaches must be able to commit to attend all six Saturday coaching sessions during the summer, as well as the coach training day in June. DREAM provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
10029.title: Volunteer T-Ball Coaches!

10026.description: GiGi's Playhouse NYC is a Down Syndrome Achievement Center based in Harlem and serving the 5 boroughs. During the summer, we offer a series of unique educational opportunities for the community to learn vital life skills and learn with their peers. Summer Horizons (ages 20+) is an educational and recreational summer program where participants with Down syndrome experience NYC, and practice important life and job skills, from navigating public spaces, to money management, all while socializing with their peers and visiting some of Manhattan's best cultural offerings. Volunteers are needed to work one-to-one with participants and guide them through the week. Prior experience preferred but not required. Partial week volunteering available, but priority will be given to those who can commit to the full week. Training provided.
10026.title: Summer Mentors for Adults with Down Syndrome
10026.org: GiGi's Playhouse, Down Syndrome Awareness Centers

10027.description: Volunteer with Behind the Book (www.behindthebook.org), a non-profit literacy organization that inspires New York City public school students to explore stories and empower their voices. Through our innovative programs, which are part of the class curricula, accomplished authors visit high-needs pre-K-12 classrooms to guide students in creating their own writing projects based on the theme of the author's book. You need no experience or training to volunteer. As a coach, you'll support and encourage students as they work on their projects. This program needs your help in Harlem, NYC. To sign up, contact volunteer@behindthebook.org with the program code and date. We'll provide the address, directions, and other information when you're confirmed: Program 15423KB-724 Date: Tuesday, July 24th Time: 10:15 AM - 12:00 PM Volunteer Role: Art coach About the program: Second- and third-graders read My Mummy is an Engineer by Kerrine Bryan to learn about engineering and women in the fields of science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM). They’ll explore building their own structures, and discover how engineers problem-solve. Coaches will guide students with an art project portraying how they would carry out their own building designs. For dates of other workshops around New York City, please visit http://www.behindthebook.org/current-volunteer-opportunities/ To join our team and receive announcements of new classroom programs and other opportunities as they're scheduled, please complete our brief questionnaire at http://www.behindthebook.org/join-us/volunteer/
10027.title: Art coach for Harlem, NYC public school literacy program (154kb)

10027.description: Market Access Program Intern Start Small Think Big (Start Small) is a not-for-profit organization located in Harlem. Our mission is to help under resourced individuals build and sustain thriving businesses in order to increase their personal financial security and stimulate economic activity in underserved communities in New York City. We believe that entrepreneurship results in increased innovation and sustained economic growth for everyone, in particular, those most traditionally marginalized. The Market Access Program Intern will work with the Marketing Program Manager to assist our entrepreneurs with marketing and sales business needs. This includes developing resource guides, learning more about sales opportunities in NYC and online, and supporting our communications team with a social media strategy. Job Responsibilities shall include, but are not limited to: Assist in managing Start Small Think Big social media platforms, including creating and posting content, identifying influencers in the space, and responding to comments and questions received from entrepreneurs. Research and develop informative resource guides focused on assisting entrepreneurs in identifying and addressing business challenges and community resources necessary to increase business success. Support the Marketing Program Manager in delivering services, via workshops, consultations, and project-based relationships, this includes managing logistics of events, coordinating entrepreneur attendance, and all necessary follow-up calls. Assist in developing the evaluation rubrics used by volunteer marketing experts to help entrepreneurs identify weaknesses in their current marketing practices. Preferred Skills/Qualifications: Current undergraduate student with strong interest in writing, social media, and communications, nonprofit program management, or other related disciplines. High level of computer proficiency including familiarity with Google Applications, social media (Facebook, Instagram and Twitter) and MS Office. Knowledge of programs: Buffer and Canva a plus. Demonstrated commitment to inclusive community/economic development, social and economic justice work, and/or anti-poverty work. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, time management, and interpersonal skills; Highly organized, creative and self-motivated; a strong problem-solver and analytical/critical thinker; and Experience working in low-income and/or immigrant communities. TO APPLY: Submit resume to: Eliza Edge, Market Access Program Manager at eliza@startsmallthinkbig.org (include subject line: \"[your name] Market Access Program Intern.\" This position is unpaid, but may be used for course credit where appropriate. Minimum 10 hours/week at our office. Hours are flexible. Start Small Think Big is an equal opportunity employer with a standing policy of nondiscrimination. This means that all qualified persons are accorded an equal opportunity for employment or promotion without regard to actual or perceived race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, disability, medical condition, marital status, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, family responsibility, personal appearance, genetic information, matriculation, or political affiliation.
10027.title: Market Access Program Intern

10027.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. The Editor is responsible for reviewing articles submitted by The Borgen Project’s national team of writers. Editors will also perform edits for articles appearing on BORGEN Magazine and The Borgen Project Blog. Our volunteer position is a part-time, work from home role. You can set your own schedule and specify how many hours per week you wish to work. - Edit and format articles submitted by national writers. - Work with writers to improve their articles. Qualifications: Must have great editing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing SEO friendly content is helpful, but not required. To apply: Please email a copy of your resume and two writing samples to hr@borgenproject.org
10027.title: Volunteer Editor- New York

11225.description: This program is for teens and college students looking for a seasonal volunteer opportunity. Based in the Prospect Park Zoo's Education Department, Discovery Guides are seasonal volunteers (14 - 22) who receive training in customer service and basic interpretation. Discovery Guides focus on a select group of visitor experiences and, in turn, gain experience with teaching, leadership, public speaking, and learn about animals and the wild places they inhabit! Discovery Guides will: Interact with children, families, and general visitors at select exhibits and educational activities around the zoo Help out with zoo birthday parties on weekends Interact with children in the Discovery Center and at our Nature Playscape Participate in the Wildlife Conservation Society's Conservation Action campaigns We are currently recruiting youth for Summer 2018. Training will be June 10, 17, 24, 28 & 29. Volunteers must commit to two full days per week for the summer season. Applications will be available on our website in March, and are due by May 1, 2018. To request an application sooner, email the Volunteer Coordinator at ppzvolunteer@wcs.org.
11225.title: Summer Discovery Guide

10025.description: Whether you're great, good or fair at Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM), you can help make an impact on inner-city youth. Here's how: The Parris Foundation S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program has returned for the Summer 2018 session. The program began after a successful summer pilot in 2012, and our subsequent programs have grown to continue to serve middle school students and high school students . With the growing impact on the community, we need your support to continue to bring STEM to our middle school and high school youth throughout New York City. As we expand to more locations to serve more youth, there is a growing need for volunteers! How we do it: The Parris Foundation curriculum combines innovative and interactive software and teaching techniques with hand-ons interdisciplinary experiments and activities to keep our students engaged with their passion for science and math! About The Parris Foundation: The Parris Foundation is dedicated to promoting educational opportunities and fostering awareness in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through scholarships and community outreach programs. The Parris Foundation's S.T.E.M.ulating Minds: Weekend Enrichment Programs provide extended learning opportunities to supplement and enhance in-school learning.
10025.title: Summer 2018 - S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program

10025.description: The New Jewiish Home, Manhattan Division has a wide variety of opportunities for high school and college students to volunteer with over the summer vacation. Opportunities vary and we will try our best to meet your interest Opportunities include but not limited to: Recreation Assistant (Bingo, Games, Exercise, Arts & Crafts, Nail Spa) Pharamacy (selective, limited spots) Library Assistant (upkeep of shelving, assisting book selections, assisting computer users) Clerical/Office Assistant Please apply online at the following link: https://www.volgistics.com/ex/portal.dll/ap?ap=1114206372 Please mention Volunteer Match & Summer Volunteering in your application If you have any questions - Please contact Jessica at JSinovoi@jewishhome.org
10025.title: Summer Volunteer at The New Jewish Home (HS & College students)
10025.org: The New Jewish Home, Manhattan Division

10023.description: We are seeking enthusiastic, creative, industrious, responsible, punctual, and best of all, creative people who can generate fun every moment of the STEM summer day camp experience. Depending upon your experience, you will work as a STEM Teacher, STEM Junior Teacher, Head Counselor, or Group Leader in the classroom, in offsite locations, or in the gymnasium/outdoor playground. Must have tons of energy, a willingness to make a fool of yourself for the sake of making someone smile, the ability to give \"warm fuzzies\" on a daily basis, and a desire to have FUN! If you have experience in any of the following, this camp is for you: visual art, music, dramatic art, mad science, coding, maker faire, financial literacy, entrepreneurship, community service, activism, literacy, education, chess, juggling, sports, yoga, fire throwing, marching band, drill team, gardening, cooking, learning, sharing the love and joys of learning and making friends with children.
10023.title: Teach kids how to code, engineer, and love Science!  Looking For STEM Summer Camp Teachers - NYC

10023.description: Looking for a fun and rewarding day of volunteering? Join us for NCJW NY's Back 2 S chool Store on August 5th! NCJW New York is transforming Council House into a very special department store on Sunday, August 5th, and we need you! At the Back 2 School Store, 200 elementary school children from underserved communities will \"shop\" for everything they need to go back to school with pride and enthusiasm! All items are brand new and service is free of charge. We need your help! Each child will be assigned a personal shopper to guide them through the store. Personal shoppers are a crucial part of the Back 2 School Store experience and we hope you will join us! Other volunteer opportunities include: registration, inventory, floor staff, and Family Resource Center. We also have volunteer opportunities in the weeks leading up to the store to help with data entry, set up, inventory and packing up after the store. Please email azadoff@ncjwny.org for more information and to get involved.
10023.title: Personal Shopper for the 2018 Back 2 School Store!
10023.org: National Council of Jewish Women NY Section

Our English as a Second Language program provides high quality, interactive instruction to a diverse student body. We are seeking a volunteer to facilitate an English Conversation Group for our higher level English for Speakers of Other Languages students. The volunteer will be responsible to facilitating group discussion that encourages participants to practice their English speaking skills in a supportive environment. The Conversation Group will meet on Thursdays, 1:00-2:00, July 12 - August 30.
10021.title: Summer Conversation Group Facilitator

10021.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premier human services providers, is a 124-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of integrated and effective services which significantly improve the lives of 15,000 people in need each year, on the East Side of Manhattan. 11743.title: Mommy and Me

11743.description: Who doesn't love the warmth and unconditional love from a beautiful four legged furry pet? If you love dogs, and I mean, really love dogs then you can be part of a rewarding experience. Our exclusive Pet Therapy program is currently looking for chaperones. We have committed pet therapy handlers who bring their trained and certified dogs to the hospital to visit our patients. As a chaperone you will be . . . escorting the handler and dog to the patient floors on various units. engaging and interact with our patients & families and wonderful caregivers. providing hand sanitizer to all who pet the dog. greeting patients and introducing the pet handler and pet therapy dog. able to commit to one day a week for a maximum of 2 hours, usually not more than an hour. The presence of a dog in a hospital setting allows the patients to feel more at home, as they do play a small part of the healing process. The immediate gratification you will see on the patients' and staffs' faces when they are interacting with the dog is truly amazing. There are known benefits for pet therapy visits . . . improves mood and overall well-being decreases stress and anxiety lowers blood pressure lets patients reminisce about their own animals If you are interested in volunteering in our program, please contact me for an interview. Alice Messina Patient Liaison Pet Therapy Coordinator 631-351-2399 amessina2@northwell.edu
11743.title: Pet Therapy Chaperone

08837.description: The Garden State Cat Club is looking for people to work as stewards at our upcoming Expo / Cat Show on July 21-22, 2018 at the NJ Convention and Exposition Center at the Raritan Center in Edison. Stewards get a small salary and free lunch. You must arrive at the show hall no later than 8:30am and judging ends around 4pm or whenever the judge is done as some take a bit longer. You must stay at your post at all times except for your lunch break and if there is a break between any of the classes. You will NOT be handling the cats. Only owners and judges may touch the cats in the show rings. For a description of what a steward does at a show, please read this: http://www.showcatsonline.com/x/i_love_ring_stewards_who.shtml

WE ALSO NEED PEOPLE FOR SETUP ON FRIDAY 7/20 !!!

08837.description: Canine Companions for Independence has an opening for an Event Chair and DogFest committee to lead the planning of the 2018 DogFest New Jersey Walk N Roll. Event Chair must be available to meet once a month for committee meetings and have ability to assist committee members in soliciting sponsors, recruiting teams and participants and publicizing the event. Position description is below but subject to change. Event Chair candidates will need to connect with Canine Companions staff before being approved for the position. DogFest Chairperson Work with Staff Partner to identify and recruit Committee Chairs. With the Committee Chairs, recruit volunteers to fill committee positions. Manage the committee through the planning process. Communicate with Staff Partner to ensure they are in the loop through the entire process. Serve as spokesperson for DogFest in the community Organization and communication skills to coordinate and lead committee meetings Have a well-developed network of potential sponsors, vendors and committee members Creativity to come up with ideas for fund-raising Ability to participate in meetings during work days and evenings both by phone and face to face in Irving Follow up skills needed to keep various committee info updated and on track Passion for the cause because it will come out in the message presented Ability and willingness to speak in public meetings and at Canine Companions events to promote DogFest and drive committee membership and event participation Ability to assist committee in soliciting sponsorships, recruiting teams and participants and publicizing event Previous event planning and fundraising experience helpful

07650.description: We are running free after schools for children underprivileged in order to give chances for them to get self esteem and confidence in learning. Most of our kids are immigrants who are struggling to settle down in new circumstances. you can teach our children so that they can share what they learn from you with others. Any kind of talent that makes our children and audience happy is greatly appreciated. We have one free after school in Palisades Park and the other in Bergenfield, New Jersey. We will resume 3rd one in Northern Virginia. Classes are from 4:00 PM to 6:10 PM on Monday to Thursday.
07650.title: Joyful Summer Learning Program (Summer School)

07003.description: Be a Literacy Volunteer Share the Gift of Reading, Writing, and Speaking English Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex & Passaic Counties (LVA), is a non-profit organization dedicated to helping adults improve their ability to speak, read, and write English. As an LVA volunteer, you can help people achieve a more rewarding life through weekly tutoring in reading, writing, and speaking English. We have a long list of students waiting for help. Our students are comprised both of English speakers who need help becoming proficient at reading and writing, and speakers of other languages who need help learning English. The first step to becoming an LVA tutor is to register for one of Tutor-Training Workshops. Please visit our website at www.lvaep.org or call 973-566-6200, ext 225, or text 973-441-3200 for more details. \"Literacy is a bridge from misery to hope.\" Kofi Annan
07003.title: Share Your Gift of Literacy
07003.org: Literacy Volunteers of America, Essex and Passaic Counties

07018.description: As a Programming and Student Engagement Volunteer, your primary role would be to ensure that administrative tasks (data entry, outreach to parents, outreach to students, making flyers, etc.) are complete. On at least a weekly (high school students)/monthly (college students) basis, you would communicate with students to provide ongoing motivation, encouragement and connection to each other and the program. In addition, you would support and coordinate external activities such as volunteer opportunities, events and trips and more Programming and Student Engagement Volunteers should commit for at least 6 months and commit to up to 5 hours a week depending on projects and tasks.

07018.description: The Pearl Club has a mission to educate, empower and support young women to overcome poverty by fostering advanced educational pursuit. Through our programming, The Pearl Club University, we strive to empower young women to overcome poverty by attaining a post-secondary degree. The position of the Board of Directors is a voluntary position that serves as the leadership, sustainability and growth of the organization. In this role, there are three focuses: Strategic Oversight: approve annual budgets, strategic plans and review and measure outcomes; provide strategic leadership Sustainability: actively participate in fundraising initiatives, see this as a philanthropic priority and assist in identifying board members and contribute to the annual performance of ED Commitment: actively participate and attend board meetings and take a proactive approach to the growth of the organization Within these three focuses, the Board of Directors is responsible for the following: Actively attend board meetings, including preparing for meetings Strong commitment to the organization's mission and purpose by acting as a brand ambassador and connecting/extending the organization to your network and beyond Open, honest and unbiased communication Thorough decision making that aligns with the mission, is student- and future-focused Actively participate in board fundraising goals and organizational fundraising initiatives Think outside of the box to produce outcomes, develop relationships, generate partnerships and provide opportunities for young women Stay current on important trends that relate to their expertise as it relates to the growth and success of the organization Be inspired to share their involvement with their networks to garner support and build relationships, including inviting them to all events and providing contacts to include in our email distribution lists Willingness to step out of comfort zone to produce outcomes, including trainings and professional development We are looking for someone with the following: Experience launching and building a new brand/organization Interest in growing a sustainable organization Connected to Education + corporations Experience with Fundraising, Leading and planning initiatives Provide strategic leadership experience A desire to be hands-on w/high level of initiative
07018.title: Join Our Board of Directors

10314.description: If you 55 years of age or older and looking for a way to stay active and healthy, are newly retired, or just have some free time on your hands - then volunteering is for you. The Retired and Senior Volunteer Program of the Community Service Society is a national program that matches people who want to help, with a volunteer assignment that best suits their skills and interests. The time commitment can be as little as 2 hours a day to several days a week -- depending on how much time you want to share. As a volunteer you can feed the hungry at soup kitchens and food pantries or by delivering meals to homebound elderly. You can visit the sick as a Hospice volunteer or nursing home friendly visitor. RSVP volunteers also help by tutoring children who are having difficulty learning to read, and by preparing adults and recent immigrants for the high school equivalency exam or to find employment. Some volunteers help by providing administrative support at local non-profit organizations, while others assist local museums and cultural institutions as docents. There is usually something for everyone! There are dozens of opportunities right here in Staten Island. To learn more about this program and to see if volunteering is right for you, call 718-494-3222 or email tdicostanzo@cssny.org. A little of your time can make a big difference in someone else’s life.
10314.title: Variety of oppotunities for Older Adults in Staten Island

10562.description: What does the Parent Child Together Program Do? Parent Child Together provides parents with peer-to-peer learning opportunities with a focus on positive parenting skills, early childhood development and school readiness. While the parents learn, the children participate in activities within the classroom covering shapes, colors, numbers, letters, pre literacy concepts as well as helping them gain the social emotional and self regulation skills needed prior to entering Kindergarten. What do the Volunteers Do? In the first hour the parents and children work separately and at this point, staff and volunteers help the children with separation and also carrying out the activities for the hour. In the second hour, parents and children come together for activities and the role of the staff and volunteers at this point, is to model techniques for struggling parents and assist when a parent has more than one child in the program. We ask for a minimum commitment of 6 months - if possible (there is flexibility for vacations etc.)
10562.title: Parent Child Together program volunteer in Ossining

10019.description: Estamos buscando un voluntario para acompañar a un encantador señor de 90+ años. Él vive en la parte sureste de la ciudad de New York. A él le encanta jugar domin ó , mirar noticias y novelas. Él te necesita solo una hora a la semana. GRACIAS. We match isolated and lonely seniors with volunteers in the community who make weekly visits in the senior’s home. The Friendly Visiting program is an opportunity to form rewarding relationships and ongoing companionship for both seniors and volunteers. Seniors and their visitor can converse and enjoy the company, take part in activities like going to cafes and museums, share stories, learn new skills, and a variety of other things based on the desires of the companions. You will be matched with a senior who has a similar personality and interests and you can decide together how to spend your time. Visits can easily fit into your schedule because matches are made based on your availability. We ask for a minimum commitment of 6 months or 1 year. Your time as a friendly visitor is invaluable, and you gain a new friend!
10019.title: Necisitamos Voluntario Para Acompañar Encantador Caballero De 90 Años - Adora Jugar Dominó ¡Gracias!

10018.description: DESCRIPTION The Trevor Project is dedicated to recruiting qualified volunteers to provide life-saving, life-affirming support to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and questioning (LGBTQ) youth. Our volunteers accomplish societal and individual change by creating safe spaces for LGBTQ youth in crisis and promoting awareness of Trevor’s resources. Trevor Lifeline volunteers are trained to answer calls on the Trevor Lifeline from young people who are feeling suicidal or need a safe, non-judgmental place to talk. This is an onsite volunteer opportunity and those interested need to live near our call centers which are located in LA. Time Commitment: **Note: Volunteers must be available for all training dates and times. Lifeline NY Updates July 2018 Lifeline Training: Orientation: Thursday, July 12th | 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM EST Training Dates: July 14-15th, 21-22nd (Sat/Sun) | 9:30 AM - 6:30 PM EST Post-Training: Thursday, August 23rd | 7:00 PM - 9:00 PM EST Trevor Lifeline Shift Times (we ask that volunteers commit to two 4-hour shifts per month): Sunday - Tuesday | 1:45pm - 6:00pm EST (New York) Wednesday - Thursday | 5:45pm - 10:00pm EST (New York) Friday - Saturday | 1:45pm - 6:00pm EST (New York) Required Skills and Qualifications: You are open to constantly learning. You are good at practicing self-care. You fit the profile of an ideal Lifeline volunteer: Genuine Empathetic Non-judgmental Empowering HOW TO APPLY **Please note: You must be at least 18 years old to volunteer. If you are under 18, please consider our Trevor Youth Ambassador Council. For more information, visit our website on trevorproject.org or reach out to our Community Engagement Coordinator Ashley Choi at Ashley.Choi@thetrevorproject.org.
10018.title: Trevor Project NY Lifeline Volunteer

10018.description: Fiver Children's Foundation is seeking two (2) efficient and detail-oriented Database Administrative Volunteers to join their team! Responsibilities for this position include but or not limited to, recording important information about the participants who attended and will attend Camp Fiver, Fiver's Summer Residential Program. This information is crucial when evaluating the success of Camp Fiver, evaluating and seeking funding, scheduling of Camp Programs, and maintaining pertinent contact information about Fiver Families. Fiver's Database Administrative Volunteers will assist Fiver in making a positive impact on the lives of youth throughout New York City and Central New York by successfully fulfilling the responsibilities of the volunteer position. Responsibilities include: Review Camp Fiver 2018 Applications and Health Forms Enter and update information collected from Fiver's 2018 Camp Applications Check for accuracy regarding addresses, Program Stages and assigned Session for each participant Conduct outreach for outstanding documents Any additional tasks related to this position as assigned Requirements for this position: Detail oriented Self-starter who can execute assignments independently A strong work ethic and sets high standards for his/her/their own work Strong organizational skills Analytical skills Experience with data entry and Excel preferred Language Skills Required: Spanish speaking preferred, but not required Fiver's Administrative Volunteers will: Attend a training on the software that will be used throughout the volunteer position Play a crucial role in a nonprofit that makes a 10-year commitment to youth throughout New York City and central New York and empowers them to make ethical and healthy life choices, become engaged citizens, and succeed in school, careers, and life. Be a member of a vibrant and divers team of staff members and volunteers Develop professionally through this volunteer position Assist Fiver Children's Foundation with the organization of information regarding Fiver participants who attended and will be attending Camp Fiver this summer Time Commitment: Must be able to commit a minimum of 10 - 15 hours on Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday Dates: May 2018 - August 2018 If you are interested in this volunteer opportunity, please email your resume to casie@fiver.org.

TO QUALIFY AS A SEED COACH, YOU ARE: Equipped with at least two years of professional experience and great writing skills Ready to commit to Attendance at Boot Camp Digital once a week bi-weekly one-to-one writing and college sessions (Sept-Nov) Monthly in-person SEED workshops (Sept-Dec), and other special events Prepared to maintain clear and frequent communication with Seeds of Fortune, Inc.’s Program staff and your Scholar Eager to share in our mission to empower the next generation of women of color ​ AS A SEED COACH, YOU CAN EXPECT:​ To become an essential part of a young girl finding her voice Training and ongoing guidance as you build her college application Frequent communication with compassionate and knowledgeable staff and experienced volunteers An opportunity to grow with a dynamic community, and team retreat

10013.description: VOLUNTEER NEEDED FOR OUR MANHATTAN OFFICE INSIDE OF FEDCAP. DUTIES: --Greet the client --Explain that we take pictures and they have to sign a waiver [(we can cut their heads off on the picture, should they not want to be seen) Not mandatory for receiving services] --Measure assist them in tying a tie (if they do not know how) finding a suit, shirt, slacks, shoes, etc. that fits. (They can try on the clothing in the restroom.) --Arrange for the hemming of pants or the sewing on of buttons with the tailor and set a date for the client to pick up the tailored items. If no alterations are needed, then fold up the items and place in a bag for the client. --Keep records of activities and calls in the log. --Be able to work alone, with minimal supervision or with others We are doing one day a week, for now (date to be discussed), but the time will be 10 AM to 3 PM. This is a great opportunity for anyone wanting to go into law enforcement and who wants to see \"the other side\" after a person comes home, someone that wants to be in the fashion industry, or social services/non-profit sector. 11231.description: Love to eat? Want to eat, drink, experience new restaurants, chefs, food establishment folks while doing good? Then, volunteer for our 4th Tastes of Brooklyn Carroll Gardens-Cobble Hill Summer Crawl - a Food Fest. You can join us anytime that day, to help set up, or work during the event, or breakdown. Event: Sunday, July 29 Time: 4-7 pm People buy tickets for 4 tastes for $20 or 11 tastes for $50 and walk along Court and Smith and Henry Streets in Brooklyn, below Atlantic Avenue, just off the F and G trains at Bergen and Carroll Streets. We need volunteers to buy a ticket at tastesofbrooklyn.com to support Seeds in the Middle (seedsinthemiddle.org) work to empower kids in central Brooklyn's food deserts to create healthy choices. In the past, we have had more than 20 restaurants taking part along Smith, Court and Henry Streets, between Atlantic Avenue and 4th Street in Carroll Gardens. We are still welcoming more for this event. What you can do! work beside chefs to serve food at restaurants or mark tickets lead a group tour (you'd need to gather info first about the restaurants first so you can talk about it - great experience for someone who wants to be a tour guide - email us at tastesofbrooklyn.com) lead a group of kids on a scavenger hunt (where they have to find clues at different restaurants and when they get all them, win a prize) work our youth-run Hip2B Healthy Market, where youth serve fresh OJ, parfaits, air-popped popcorn to show healthy snacks can be delicious! hand out flyers put up flyers help us advertise and sell tickets anything else you can think of to make this a success No experience needed. Just be reliable. You don't have to do the whole time, just volunteer at least two hours, preferably four. Email us at tastesofbrooklyn@gmail.com See the event at bit.ly/brooklynsummercrawl Join the event at : https://www.facebook.com/events/270771653660368/ Like Tastes of Brooklyn on Facebook Follow us on Instagram and Twitter. These wonderful restaurants are donating food to support kids in underserved neighborhoods. Help us show them love and build their small businesses, too.
11231.title: Cooks! Food Lovers Wanted -  July 29 in Carroll Gardens, BK Crawl

11231.description: Eat. Drink. For Good. Help us plan and expand Tastes of Brooklyn's Carroll Gardens-Cobble Hill Summer Crawl - scheduled for SUNDAY, JULY 29 TIME: 2-6 PM TICKETS: 4 tastes for $20, 11 tastes for $50 Supporting Seeds in the Middle's student-run Hip2B Healthy Markets, Chef Nights and edible gardens in schools, and our soccer program for at-risk and underserved children in central Brooklyn and beyond!!! We give community service credits, recommendation letters, you name it. Great for anyone looking to expand contacts in culinary and hospitality industries and just to intern this summer! Help us: Reach out to food and drink establishments from Atlantic Ave. south along Court, Henry, Smith Sts. Publicize in any way you know - help hand out flyers anywhere Social Media - post on food sites or just share on your Instagram, Snapchat, Facebook, etc. Get friends to buy tickets! Help chefs plan menus Day of - help chefs and participants Reach out to tourist businesses and encourage them to bring groups Day of and before - run Hip2B Healthy juice stands in neighborhood to show what we do If you like summer cocktails, help us organize a cocktail competition or something like that :) GUEST CHEFS WELCOME! If you love food and drink , like planning events, are organized, detail oriented and outgoing, please join us. Must be reliable. Email us at tastesofbrooklyn@gmail.com and tell us what you can do and when you are available. Ticket site: bit.ly/brooklynsummercrawl Website: tastesofbrooklyn.com
11231.title: Foodie? Chef? Event planner? Join Tastes of BK Carroll Gdns-Cobble Hill Crawl

10011.description: The Children’s Tumor Foundation is a non-profit organization dedicated to funding critical research that will one day end neurofibromatosis. In addition to benefiting those who live with NF, this research is also shedding new light on several forms of cancer, brain tumors, bone abnormalities, and learning disabilities, ultimately benefiting the broader community. The Children’s Tumor Foundation also supports people living with NF and their families with accurate, current and readily accessible information, and assists in the development of clinical centers to create better access to quality healthcare. We are in need of several committee members to join our team of NF Walk Organizers! The role of the committee member may be: To partner with and support the event chair in planning the event within the community. Help motivate, recruit and retain the participants. Communicate with the event Chair on a regular basis and be proactive in the community promoting the event. Assist with logistics and pre-event planning. Securing donations for a raffle, picnic and fundraising. Recruit and organize event-day volunteers. Assist with event-day activity planning and management and post event wrap up. Join the CTF Volunteer Team and see what a difference one person can make! Event site: https://join.ctf.org/event/2018-nf-walk-nyc/e163860
